story:
Octagon is an artist collective of eight individuals. Our practices address themes of innocence and corruption through a diverse range of image and installation. Fundamental to our work is the breaking of gallery limitations, as we adapt to alternative sites to provoke a subtle dislocation of accepted norms. By transforming derelict spaces we demonstrate the relation between intervention, experience and location as our artworks evolve from the site. As young contemporary artists we aim to challenge social conventions, and are currently influenced by the late David Bowie’s song ‘We Prick You’. Exploring the lyrical connotations, our bold statement pieces enforce the cultural significance of the song for a younger generation.

For this project, hosted within the deteriorating walls of an abandoned brick workshop in the West End of Lincoln, we will require fundraising for the absolute basics of bringing our work to the space. This involves potentially making the property leak-proof and secure, al the way up to the funding for a generator- to provide electricity for lighting and TV/projector equipment, as well as various planning permissions for a skip and for the on-the-night hosting of the public event.

As the first time the group of us have come together for an exhibition- the event of course has its risks, and this comes generally from the fact that none of us have ever attempted to do something on this scale before. What we do know is that our derelict exhibition site and abandoned residential atmosphere is completely unique to anything seen before, and the range of works within it will either collide together to make something completely unanticipated and obscure, or it could create something revolutionising.

Any donation, even if it seems like change in your pocket, will make a huge contribution to the success of our one-off exhibition. Other ways you can help would simply be to spread the word and like our Facebook page.

story:
Why The Five Minute Dream?

There are moments in time when we could all use a little encouragement. Whether it's been a tough day, a tough week or a tough year!

Maybe you just landed your biggest client yet and now you're about to hit the panic button because you don't know how you're going to get the job done!

Maybe you've lost sight of what it is you REALLY want? Or are you just too busy to stop and think about things? Is everything piling in on top of you or someone you know?

My mum gave me a card years ago that said 'Follow Your Dreams'. That card has lived on the pin board in my office and I've looked at it every day for over ten years.

I'm launching The Five Minute Dream to encourage people to just reflect for a few minutes each day on what their dreams are, what they really want, and to help them stay inspired and work towards it.

I thought greeting cards and bookmarks were a great place to start. They are nice to use yourself, or give as gifts, send to a loved one, a client, final year students, everyone with a dream, inspiration or aspiration!

I've added some images below of some of the artwork (not all!) There are seven sayings, and each saying is available across all designs, so 42 designs in all.

Retail pricing will be as follows:

Cards $5.95
Bookmarks $2.95
12" x 12" Printed Canvas $34.95
Coffee mugs, tote bags and journals to follow next!

Of course, wholesale pricing for businesses will also be available.

The Nitty Gritty!

I'm raising funds to get my first print run done of greeting cards and bookmarks. The funding is for printing the cards, getting envelopes, and plastic sleeves to put them in.

Regardless of the amount I raise, it will all be going towards the first print run. The amount of funding will determine the size of the run. It will cover sample stock, stock to fulfill any orders placed here, plus some stock to start fulfilling orders.

In other words, it will get me up and running!

The Impact

People need inspiration and dreams. We all need to look ahead and keep ourselves moving forward. What better gift to give than something people can look at every day to help them remember their dreams, to help keep them inspired, to help them keep moving forward? A message to tell them that they CAN do whatever it is they think they can? A message to encourage them through tough times?

And Please...

I would really appreciate your help getting the word out!

Please use the Indiegogo share tools and spread the word to help get the world inspired again!

Thanks for stopping by!

story:
Help me make this real!

My hope is that Marooned in Space! will be a fun Science Fiction read that people will enjoy. There might be a few big ideas in it, but primarily the book is for entertainment. In case you don't know me, I'm a TV writer, having written for some great shows like 'MadTV', 'This Hour Has 22 Minutes', 'Corner Gas' and 'That's So Weird'. My biggest deal was likely co-creating the sketch/sitcom hybrid TV show Sunnyside, with Dan Redican. I've also worked as an actor, a director and an animator. This is my third novel, the others, 'Slapshot of Love' and 'Me and the Crack Mayor' were also self published. You can get them at Amazon all over the world. 

Do you like awards? I've won some and been nominated for a bunch more. They are very shiny, and I enjoyed winning them, but I've found they don't convert to cash the way I'd like.  

Here's a good question... Why don't I just get a publisher? ...the answer is...I tried and found no interest. Damn! I have lots of rejection letters which I keep for inspiration. I've read that J.K Rowling and Stephen King have kept all their rejections. So, we have that much in common. However, the cool thing about today's culture, whether it's Youtube or Funny or Die or self publishing, the old gate keepers can't keep you from making your art. You can do it yourself. In this case, I'll be doing it myself, with some help, hopefully from you! 

What about government or arts grants? No luck there, either. To be honest, I don't think I write the kind of thing that gets grants. It's just too dumb.

 So this campaign takes this book, which right now is just a bunch of words and drawings on my hard drive and makes it into an actual book which you'll be able read in paperback or digital version. It will be sold all around the world on Amazon.  

What is the dream? That people read and enjoy the book. Beyond that, there is the knowledge that 50 Shades of Grey and The Martian both started as self published books. It is highly unlikely that my book would have a lightning strike like those two, but I might as well dream big, right? 

What I Need The Money For...

Five thousand bucks is a lot of money. So what will it be used for? Let me tell you where the expenses come in. Maybe you want to self publish your own book- here's what you're up against. 
1. You need an editor and you need to pay that editor. I had an excellent one, Carly Jones. She is not getting anywhere near what she deserves for her work. 
2. The cover design needs to look good and professional. Jodi Boyer did that for me and I love her stuff. Again, Jodi is underpaid. 
3. The original file that I wrote the book in...good old Microsoft Word...has to be converted for both the Kindle edition and a print version. This costs money from an outside company. Hard cash comes in here as there are no friendly favours from those guys. 
4. While I have a front cover, Amazon does the back cover and spine. This is another hard cost I can't get around.
5. Publicity. I need to tell the world the book is out. That will cost some money.  
6. Pay for writing. No, I will not be paid for writing the book through this fundraiser. I only make money if anyone buys the book once it is out. The novel will be priced around five dollars for a digital version, and around sixteen dollars for the paperback. In either case, on each sale, I'll pocket three or four dollars before expenses. 

What your money really does

It encourages me to keep writing! It tells me my work has some value. If you do contribute, you'll be small part of literature history. Okay, tiny part. Minuscule. Barely noticeable, but it will mean a lot to me.  

Other things you could do with your money

Oh, so many things, really. Food. Shelter. Fun. You could give to charities that could save the world. You could buy yourself something you always wanted. You could purchase some great gift for a loved one. Now I'm really regretting including this part. I have no idea why I put this in. It's totally counter productive to what I'm trying to do here. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Money is tight. I get it. I know a lot of actors, writers, directors and other artists who have a similar up and down trajectory to their careers as I do. And if you read the paragraph above, you know there are a lot of uses for whatever money you have. You can still help me by spreading this page to your friends through Facebook and Twitter. Use the Indiegogo share tools. That would be really nice of you. And just tell people about it in person out in the Real-O-Sphere. 

The other thing I'd like, if you're low on cash, is if, when the book comes out in a couple of months, you buy one. I promise I will keep the digital copy about the same as a Starbucks coffee and not even as much as the fancy ones. It's going to be about five bucks for digital, about sixteen for paperback.  And if you like the book, you can post a review on Amazon or bookish websites. And if you don't like the book, you can help me by not telling anyone about it.

story:
Short Summary

Since 2014 we have published three volumes of African Lens. The love, feedback and support has been incredible and encouraging. We are looking forward to the next phase of bringing African Lens to the people across of Africa via exhibitions. Help us tell the African story through photographs in all the four parts of the beautiful continent and beyond. North, East, West and South Africa!

Beyond Publication:

African Lens is devoted to be a staple for African photographers to share their stories. Create a community forum for communication and creative expression. To inspire, help and give direction to African creatives and talents.  

We plan on hosting an exhibition in all aspects of Africa (North, East, West, Central and Southern Africa) with photography from African Lens publication. 

We begin with phase one in Cape Town, South Africa in December 2016, then Morocco (North Africa) Ghana, (West Africa) and finally Kenya (East Africa).

Besides exhibitions, we will have talk sessions to connect and interact with the people. Our aim is to be hands on with the people, share ideas and knowledge, learn from each other, inspire and empower each other. 

In every country we visit, we will work on original editorial projects that will put a spotlight and attention on important and untapped aspects of Africa. We will collaborate with the native photographers, document the experience and build more material for future publications. 

As photographers and creatives, we believe in the power of visual storytelling thus, using photography as a voice and platform to tell a true, diverse and balanced story of the motherland.

COUNTRIES WE WILL EXHIBIT (PHASE 1) :

South Africa

Ghana

Morocco

Kenya

 

Select Photographers

TJ Letsa - Ghana 

Fundiswa Ntoyi- South Africa 

Zakaria Wakrim - Morocco

Yannis - Gabon 

Hisaham A. Mamoun - Sudan 

Plus more....

 

WHO IS BEHIND AFRICAN LENS?:

Aaron Yeboah Jr: Editor-in Chief/Designer

TJ Letsa: Art Director

Siki Msuseni: Project Manager

Keni Kodjo: Writer

Danielle Kenner: Advisory 

--

Aaron Yeboah Junior

African Lens is a brain child of Ghanaian born visual creative Aaron Yeboah Jr. Yeboah is devoted to establishing a creative platform open for expression as well as helping and guiding creatives. Aaron Yeboah lived and worked in the United States for 10 years and moved to Ghana in 2005 to establish SCRIBE creative agency and expand African Lens publication to reach across Africa. Using African Lens to bring a positive light on Africa; thus providing a positive representation of Africa through the powerful medium of photography.

TJ Letsa

T.J Letsa is a Ghanaian born and Accra based photographer/lawyer. TJ Letsa studied law and graduated with an LLB(Hons) from the  University of London. TJ  also enrolled at a local university for a one year foundation course in Ghanaian law. His path in life shifted when he picked up a camera. As a self-taught photographer,  photography is Jonathan’s voice. It is how he communicate with the world outside;  Jonathan doubles up in the legal field and as a creative. In the legal field, he helps manage a host of companies to ensure that their legal obligations and corporate governance are up to date with the Ghanaian regulatory bodies. Jonathan also provides African creatives with exceptional management, development and creative direction.

 

PERKS

 

WHERE THE FUNDS RAISED FROM THIS CAMPAIGN WILL GO:

Product costs for Photography Prints, Framing etc

Production cost for Tote Bags

Production cost for Volume 4 print

Production cost for Collectors edition print

Production cost for Volume 1-3 print

Exhibition Space for 4 countries

Flight Ticket & Accommodation for 4 countries

Indiegogo's slice

PRESS & MEDIA:

Okay Africa:

http://www.okayafrica.com/culture-2/african-len...

Dynamic Africa:

http://dynamicafrica.tumblr.com/post/1264795618...

Creative Review:

https://www.creativereview.co.uk/african-lens-n...

Creative Nestlings:

http://creativenestlings.com/conversations/aaro...

IDOL mag:

http://www.idolmag.co.uk/arts/the-compelling-ph...

THANK YOU

Please if you aren’t in a position to support the African Lens exhibition at this time, that’s okay! We appreciate your help in spreading the word about and using the share tools here on IndieGoGO. Visit our website, tweet and blog about us! Direct others who might be able to help get involved! Anything and everything is welcomed!

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

- Exhibition dates and spaces are subject to change, Backers and supports will be informed and updated.

- Production and Shipping dates may delay but rest assured we will deliver.

story:
La Factrie, c’est un mélange du patrimoine culturel de Salaberry-de-Valleyfield et de l’histoire de l’art. En effet, le nom fait référence à la fameuse Factory d’Andy Warhol (on parle ici du côté effervescent du fameux lieu culte !) qui a permis à des centaines d’artistes de tous les styles d’arts de s’émanciper. De plus, le mot Factrie était très utilisé dans les années 60 pour faire référence aux manufactures, telles que notre fameuse Montreal Cotton. 

Le projet est né à la suite d’une étude de marché sous forme d'entrevues et de sondages qui ont été menés auprès de 150 personnes de la communauté. Cette initiative est née sous l’impulsion d’un comité d’orientation composé, entre autres, de représentants du Café Agora, du Collège de Valleyfield et de la Ville de Salaberry-de-Valleyfield. Les 25 et 26 septembre 2015 a eu lieu la première fin de semaine d'activités. Elle a permis de valider l’intérêt des Campivallensiens en vue de l'implantation permanente d'un café culturel au centre-ville de Salaberry-de-Valleyfield. Ce sont Cyndi Trudel et Émilie Fortier, deux anciennes du Collège de Valleyfield, qui travaillent d'arrache-pied depuis maintenant près d'un an pour faire naître ce beau projet!

Le concept 

Développer un lieu agréable où les gens d’action, de réflexion et de culture pourront se réunir. Leur ouvrir les portes d’un endroit où ils pourront libérer leur folie, vivre des émotions, confronter leurs idées.

Créer une culture de partage pour que ces citoyens puissent découvrir des artistes et les organismes socioculturels qui triment fort chez nous. Créer un lieu inspirant qui favorise les échanges, l’entraide et le réseautage.

La programmation 

Ce ne sera pas des shows, mais des événements! Des bibittes qu’on aime voir, entendre, goûter… Des bibittes idéalement conçues dans le Suroît, pas parce qu’on est né pour un petit pain, mais parce qu’on est fier de notre coin de pays. On souhaite aussi que les activités pour la famille soient au cœur de la programmation et qu’en soirée cette atmosphère familiale laisse place à une ambiance plus festive. Pour le reste, on est à la recherche de propositions qui sortent des sentiers battus et qui contribueront à créer une expérience mémorable chez les gens qui viendront fréquenter le café.

On a des idées pis de la débrouillardise. Les brocantes, les cours à scrap et le port de Valleyfield ont été arpentés pour créer le décor, agrémenter l’espace et le meubler. Dans l’optique de rajouter à l’expérience.

Menu 

Ce sera simple et pas cher, mais ô combien bon! L'alcool sera québécois, pis on aura aussi plusieurs types de café et de thés pour les amateurs!

 

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

Notre objectif est de recueillir la somme de 15 000 $. Nous avons à l'heure actuelle réussi à récolter 40 000 des 65 000 $ nécessaires à l'ouverture d'un café ayant pignon sur rue au centre-ville de Salaberry-de-Valleyfield. L'ensemble des montants recueillis servira à l'aménagement des lieux et a créé une programmation socioculturelle dynamique pour l'année 2016-2017.

En échange d'une contribution entre 25 $ et 99 $, vous obtiendrez une carte de membre régulier de La Factrie. Pour une contribution de 100 $ ou plus, vous deviendrez membre fondateur.

 

Risques et défis

À la lumière du verdict de la communauté, il a été possible de conclure qu’il y a un besoin dans la communauté pour un café culturel faisant office de lieu culturel multidisciplinaire convivial, abordable et vivant. Toutefois, l'offre en matière de culture et de restauration reste à Salaberry-de-Valleyfield somme toute importante. Il sera important de ne pas diluer l'offre culturelle. La Fatrie ne veut pas devenir une concurrente pour les acteurs déjà en place, mais bien une offre complémentaire qui attire une nouvelle clientèle. Elle devra s'appuyer sur les efforts d’un maximum d’acteurs travaillant en concertation. Dans tous les cas, il paraît essentiel que l’une des missions de La Factrie soit le développement de public culturel et la création de synergies entre l’ensemble des organismes culturels sur le territoire de la ville. La mise en place de ce lieu doit se faire de manière à impliquer le plus possible ses futurs utilisateurs pour créer dès le départ un sentiment fort pour l’institution et contribuer à créer un café leur ressemblant.

Pour minimiser les coûts d’exploitation du café culturel, il est clair que l’engagement bénévole de plusieurs utilisateurs du café sera nécessaire au sein du conseil d’administration, de comités de programmation et pour l’accomplissement de tâches courantes simples à effectuer.

Le fait de se baser sur le bénévolat est une formule gagnante qui a fait ses preuves à plusieurs reprises dans d’autres cafés culturels à travers le Québec. Cependant, on peut noter dans la région une baisse de l'implication bénévole au cours des dernières années, ainsi qu'un épuisement des bénévoles eux-mêmes. Il sera primordial de développer un sentiment d’appartenance des utilisateurs envers leur café culturel. Ce qui a déjà été solidement enclenché au cours des 2 dernières années, notamment avec les rencontres individuelles qui ont eu lieu lors de l'étude de marché. Aussi, la première fin de semaine d'activité a déjà permis aux organisateurs de créer un bassin de personne impliquée qui a à coeur le projet. Finalement, plusieurs organismes sont vivement actifs au sein du projet dont le Café Agora qui a déjà offert une somme de 15 000$ pour mener à terme ce projet. L’idée sera également de faire en sorte que le café reste connecté sur les besoins de la population campivallensienne en étant un lieu pour et par les citoyens.

 

D'autres façons d'aider

Si vous n'êtes pas en mesure de contribuer financièrement au projet, nous avons également besoin de personnes intéressées à donner du temps autant pour l'aménagement du local que pour s'impliquer au sein du conseil d’administration, de comités de programmation et pour l’accomplissement de tâches courantes simples à effectuer.

Vous pouvez contacter Émilie Fortier à cet effet à l'adresse suivante : emilie.fortier@lafactrie.org

Merci aussi de bien vouloir faire passer le mot auprès de vos proches et vos amis!
story_txt:
La Factrie, c’est un mélange du patrimoine culturel de Salaberry-de-Valleyfield et de l’histoire de l’art. En effet, le nom fait référence à la fameuse Factory d’Andy Warhol (on parle ici du côté effervescent du fameux lieu culte !) qui a permis à des centaines d’artistes de tous les styles d’arts de s’émanciper. De plus, le mot Factrie était très utilisé dans les années 60 pour faire référence aux manufactures, telles que notre fameuse Montreal Cotton. 
Le projet est né à la suite d’une étude de marché sous forme d'entrevues et de sondages qui ont été menés auprès de 150 personnes de la communauté. Cette initiative est née sous l’impulsion d’un comité d’orientation composé, entre autres, de représentants du Café Agora, du Collège de Valleyfield et de la Ville de Salaberry-de-Valleyfield. Les 25 et 26 septembre 2015 a eu lieu la première fin de semaine d'activités. Elle a permis de valider l’intérêt des Campivallensiens en vue de l'implantation permanente d'un café culturel au centre-ville de Salaberry-de-Valleyfield. Ce sont Cyndi Trudel et Émilie Fortier, deux anciennes du Collège de Valleyfield, qui travaillent d'arrache-pied depuis maintenant près d'un an pour faire naître ce beau projet!
Le concept 
Développer un lieu agréable où les gens d’action, de réflexion et de culture pourront se réunir. Leur ouvrir les portes d’un endroit où ils pourront libérer leur folie, vivre des émotions, confronter leurs idées.
Créer une culture de partage pour que ces citoyens puissent découvrir des artistes et les organismes socioculturels qui triment fort chez nous. Créer un lieu inspirant qui favorise les échanges, l’entraide et le réseautage.
La programmation 
Ce ne sera pas des shows, mais des événements! Des bibittes qu’on aime voir, entendre, goûter… Des bibittes idéalement conçues dans le Suroît, pas parce qu’on est né pour un petit pain, mais parce qu’on est fier de notre coin de pays. On souhaite aussi que les activités pour la famille soient au cœur de la programmation et qu’en soirée cette atmosphère familiale laisse place à une ambiance plus festive. Pour le reste, on est à la recherche de propositions qui sortent des sentiers battus et qui contribueront à créer une expérience mémorable chez les gens qui viendront fréquenter le café.
On a des idées pis de la débrouillardise. Les brocantes, les cours à scrap et le port de Valleyfield ont été arpentés pour créer le décor, agrémenter l’espace et le meubler. Dans l’optique de rajouter à l’expérience.
Menu 
Ce sera simple et pas cher, mais ô combien bon! L'alcool sera québécois, pis on aura aussi plusieurs types de café et de thés pour les amateurs!
 
Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez
Notre objectif est de recueillir la somme de 15 000 $. Nous avons à l'heure actuelle réussi à récolter 40 000 des 65 000 $ nécessaires à l'ouverture d'un café ayant pignon sur rue au centre-ville de Salaberry-de-Valleyfield. L'ensemble des montants recueillis servira à l'aménagement des lieux et a créé une programmation socioculturelle dynamique pour l'année 2016-2017.
En échange d'une contribution entre 25 $ et 99 $, vous obtiendrez une carte de membre régulier de La Factrie. Pour une contribution de 100 $ ou plus, vous deviendrez membre fondateur.
 
Risques et défis
À la lumière du verdict de la communauté, il a été possible de conclure qu’il y a un besoin dans la communauté pour un café culturel faisant office de lieu culturel multidisciplinaire convivial, abordable et vivant. Toutefois, l'offre en matière de culture et de restauration reste à Salaberry-de-Valleyfield somme toute importante. Il sera important de ne pas diluer l'offre culturelle. La Fatrie ne veut pas devenir une concurrente pour les acteurs déjà en place, mais bien une offre complémentaire qui attire une nouvelle clientèle. Elle devra s'appuyer sur les efforts d’un maximum d’acteurs travaillant en concertation. Dans tous les cas, il paraît essentiel que l’une des missions de La Factrie soit le développement de public culturel et la création de synergies entre l’ensemble des organismes culturels sur le territoire de la ville. La mise en place de ce lieu doit se faire de manière à impliquer le plus possible ses futurs utilisateurs pour créer dès le départ un sentiment fort pour l’institution et contribuer à créer un café leur ressemblant.
Pour minimiser les coûts d’exploitation du café culturel, il est clair que l’engagement bénévole de plusieurs utilisateurs du café sera nécessaire au sein du conseil d’administration, de comités de programmation et pour l’accomplissement de tâches courantes simples à effectuer.
Le fait de se baser sur le bénévolat est une formule gagnante qui a fait ses preuves à plusieurs reprises dans d’autres cafés culturels à travers le Québec. Cependant, on peut noter dans la région une baisse de l'implication bénévole au cours des dernières années, ainsi qu'un épuisement des bénévoles eux-mêmes. Il sera primordial de développer un sentiment d’appartenance des utilisateurs envers leur café culturel. Ce qui a déjà été solidement enclenché au cours des 2 dernières années, notamment avec les rencontres individuelles qui ont eu lieu lors de l'étude de marché. Aussi, la première fin de semaine d'activité a déjà permis aux organisateurs de créer un bassin de personne impliquée qui a à coeur le projet. Finalement, plusieurs organismes sont vivement actifs au sein du projet dont le Café Agora qui a déjà offert une somme de 15 000$ pour mener à terme ce projet. L’idée sera également de faire en sorte que le café reste connecté sur les besoins de la population campivallensienne en étant un lieu pour et par les citoyens.

Si vous n'êtes pas en mesure de contribuer financièrement au projet, nous avons également besoin de personnes intéressées à donner du temps autant pour l'aménagement du local que pour s'impliquer au sein du conseil d’administration, de comités de programmation et pour l’accomplissement de tâches courantes simples à effectuer.

story:
For the last 12 years I have been working on creating a life-size version of the iconic TIME MACHINE 

I first saw the movie, The Time Machine,  when I was 7 years old and it inspired me  to follow a career in film making. I started making 8mm films at the age of 9 and went on to work in nearly every field of film and video production from writing, producing, directing to cinematography  and  stop-motion animation. 
I began construction of a replica of The Time Machine in 2003 thinking it would be a  3-month project. But as I made parts for the model I became interested in the artisan crafts necessary to produce each piece faithfully.  I decided to make my Machine with "noble" materials such as brass, marble, mahogany, ceramics, etc.. This required that I learn such craft disciplines as metal spinning , stone turning, woodworking, mold making and more. That 3-month project is now in its 12th year. 

My Time Machine is, at last, ready to unveil. The event will be filmed as part of an upcoming documentary exploring the obsession with time travel.Here is the trailer for the film...


Recently, I have been creating unique lighting fixtures using vintage items. This is a Zoetrope made with a cast iron lamp and parts from an antique hand drill...


Many of the "perks" offered, are my hand made objects.

For $100 

36" X 24" Poster Of The Time Machine

36"x 24" print of Chris Perrotta's black and white Time Machine drawings. These drawings represent a dimensionally accurate version of the M.G.M. movie prop and have been use to produce scale model recreations. See the photo below.


For $250 

Resin Casting of Brass Flourish (numbered and signed) 

One of the decorative elements on the Time Machine which makes it the ornate Victorian beauty it is. I have had the privilege of visiting and studying the original Machine in the  Los Angeles "museum" owned by Bob Burns. You receive a resin casting from my original mold mounted on a wooden base. Its signed and numbered. Watch the video below to see where on the Time Machine this part is located.



For $275 

Hand Made Vintage Seltzer Bottle Light




For $250 

One Of A Kind 
Alfa Romeo Wine Bottle Pendent Light


For $275 

One Of A Kind 

Vintage Iconic Flat Iron Table Light

While traveling through time, I found this classic flat iron from the 1950's. I could not resist shining some new light on this vintage iconic object. I also created the base to resemble a vintage ironing board complete with muslin fabric. This is a one of a kind piece.


For $285

Figurative Bookend 

Cast from the 1898 antique Berninghaus Barber Chair used in the Time Machine. Faux finished and mounted on oak.  Watch the video below to see its location on the Machine.


For $300 

Vintage Oil Can - Flashlight Lamp

Two iconic objects from the passed get joined and function as a very cool lighting fixture. Great as a desk lamp or to spotlight a photo or painting on a wall. These are all hand made and vary a bit in color.



For $350 

20" Tall Vintage Oil Can - Flashlight Lamp

The on/off switch is the oil pump lever!

Two iconic objects from the passed get joined and function as a very cool lighting fixture. Great as a desk lamp of to spotlight a photo or painting on a wall. These are all hand made and vary a bit. This one is about 20" tall. The oil pump lever is the on/off switch!


For $480 

1948 Polaroid Camera Light

In 1948  Polaroid introduced the Land Camera, which produced prints in about 1 minute. I have taken this classic instant film camera and transformed it into a beautiful one of-a-kind lighting fixture. There are TWO lights. Both the lens and the flash unit can be lit together or separately. The on/off switch for the lens light is the actual shutter release button. The Camera sits on an all metal vintage tripod with extending legs so it can be used as a table lamp or a floor lamp! 


For $600

The Time Machine Crystal Control Lever

This beauty was hand crafted by Hollywood prop builder, Don Coleman. For many years, Don has been creating wonderful art for major productions  including StarTrek. Its constructed using solid brass. The  crystal, the source of the Machine's power, is 30%+ lead crystal.The handle is a urethane casting meticulously painted to resemble green marble.

story:
Greetings and peace and blessings...

My name is Fatima Simbala, and I'm here to announce the impending launch of my new online magazine venture into the world of Black sexuality,   The Temple of Black Eroticism.

The Temple of Black Eroticism will focus on all things sexual and sensual for people of African Descent; from sacred sexuality to sexual skills; from mainstream erotica to sexual fetishes spanning the full range of BDSM. Its ultimate aims are to not only keep the brothers 'hard' and the sisters 'wet' but also to weave in the sentiments of Black love and affirmation.

But to achieve these lofty objectives, I am humbly asking for any donations that you can afford to help finance The Temple of Black Eroticism's up and coming photo shoots (some featuring yours truly!) and other upcoming projects and erotic gatherings in the communities of color. 

Please be bold and donate a little something....this project is ambitious because we aim to embrace, and express, all of our sensual and humane pleasures as an African people without shame or guilt.

But here's something for you guys! All donations to The Temple of Black Eroticism has  the following benefits: 

 1) donations of 5 dollars will give you exclusive access to premium services and content on the website for 30 days. (once up and fully functional) 

2) donations of 15 dollars will give you exclusive access to premium services and content on the website for 30 days and a chance to win a $25 visa gift card. 

3) donations of $25 will receive exclusive access to premium services and content on the website for 30 days and chance to will $25 visa gift card and a Temple of Black Eroticism T-Shirt.


Thank you so much for reading our appeal, and I hope you can support our efforts with whatever your heart can spare.

*To feature in future issues of 'The Temple', we are looking for models, authors, bloggers, radio host, speakers, investors and event planners to help get 'The Temple' up and ready for its lusty new disciples!  

For all interested promote, please make all inquiries to:

submissions@templebe.com

Templebe.com

story:
Hello, my name is Luca Pearl.

I am an art student at Purchase College in New York. I concentrate mostly on printmaking and photography. 

Often what an artist can afford limits what he or she can create. This is especially true for mediums such as photography and printmaking where certain high-cost supplies are necessary to produce an image (film, printing paper, ink, etc.). Each semester I spend many hundreds of dollars (apart from the cost of tuition) just for the minimum amount of supplies required for my classes. It can be a challenge to pursue my artistic vision when I'm running out of materials.

That's why I'm hoping to use this campaign to create a personal version of CSA (Community Supported Art instead of the usual 'Agriculture'). Individuals can help provide money for art supplies and in return I will give them some of the fruits of my labor. This would allow me to expand my work and grow as an artist, and to create original pieces that I can give back to the community that supports me. 

I have included some images of my art to give an idea of what may be expected from this campaign. To view more visit my website http://cargocollective.com/lucapearlkhosrova


Here is a list of the cost of some of the supplies:

Kodak 4 x 5" Portra 400 Color Film (10 Sheets: $42.59

Ilford HP5 PLUS 4x5" Black & White Print Film (25 Sheets): $32.90

Kodak 8 x 10" Portra 400 Color Film (10 Sheets): $164.95

Kodak Professional Portra 400 Color Negative Film (120 Roll Film): $5.99

Ilford HP5 Plus Black and White Negative Film (120 Roll Film): $4.09

Ilford HP5 Plus 8x10" 25 Sheets Black & White Negative (Print) Film (ISO-400): $109.90

Ilford Multigrade FB Classic Paper (Glossy, 8 x 10", 100 Sheets): $93.95

Ilford Multigrade FB Warmtone Fiber Base Paper (11 x 14', 50 Sheets, Glossy): $104.95

Ilford Multigrade FB Classic Paper (Glossy, 16 x 20", 10 Sheets): $45.95

Oriental Seagull Select VC-FB Black & White Cooltone Variable Contrast Double Weight Glossy Paper 8 x 10" 25 Sheets: $23.78

Industrial Grade Copper Plate 18''x24'': $73.00

White Reeves BFK 22''x30'' 25 sheets: $96.25

Any donations will help. I do not have to reach my goal amount to make this happen.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Adam Disbrow. I have a BA from the University of Virginia. I made my gallery debut as a painter in 2014 at Alexander Salazar Fine Art in San Diego, CA. (http://alexandersalazarfineart.com/artists/adam...) Since my debut I have been invited to different venues to exhibit and sell my work such as the Baltimore Convention Center in Baltimore, MD, and Javits Center in New York City, NY. I have experienced great support and appreciation from collectors and appreciators throughout the country and the world. Most recently, I won the Tom Tom Founder Festival Lamppost Banner Competition, winning a lamppost display on the outdoor walking mall of Charlottesville, VA.

My devotion is to the Arts and enhancing the world culture. I was blessed to have a private investor in the year of 2014. With his help I was able to obtain the supplies I needed to frame 14 large works and drive them from Virginia to California (I framed the works and transported them myself in July of 2014). The opening night of the exhibition was July 25th, 2014. I had the honor of sharing the opening with international phenom-Clive Barker. It was a lot of work but with the support of friends and family I met the deadline, and the dream became a reality. 

My investor's support ended December 31st, 2014. He helped me get off the ground and I am supremely grateful to him. I have received extremely positive feedback on my work from collectors in many demographics, selling over $5,000 in artwork last year. However, without your help, maintaining my current momentum will not be manageable. Please help me continue creating art that, I hope, the entire world will appreciate for centuries to come. 


What I Need & What You Get

The money raised in this campaign will go to studio space, art supplies (canvas, paint, and brushes), gas to get to and from my studio (it is 50 miles from my home), wood to build frames (as aforementioned I build my own - wood shop also 50 miles from my home). If I make the goal, I will  also purchase a new GoPro camera to create another time-lapse video like the one featured above. I no longer have the use of the camera we used to film the above video. With your help, we will make art history.

By supporting this campaign you will be actively enhancing the culture of the world, you will be playing a role in art history, and you will be supporting the passion of a soul devoted to the arts. ... But that is not all...

If you donate to this campaign I will send you a signed print of original art. Also, all contributors will receive a Special Thanks credit on future time-lapse videos (if we reach our goal). 

Whatever funds I receive from this campaign, be it the goal or far from it, will directly go into creating art! 


Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everybody can contribute money. Please, take a moment to share this with your friends and family using the share tools provided. Art and culture are what make life unique and beautiful! Thank you for your time, support, and above all your appreciation of the arts.

Sincerely,

Adam 'AD' Disbrow

"When nothing is sacred and nothing is safe, art is brave."
story_txt:
Short Summary My name is Adam Disbrow. I have a BA from the University of Virginia. I made my gallery debut as a painter in 2014 at Alexander Salazar Fine Art in San Diego, CA. (http://alexandersalazarfineart.com/artists/adam...) Since my debut I have been invited to different venues to exhibit and sell my work such as the Baltimore Convention Center in Baltimore, MD, and Javits Center in New York City, NY. I have experienced great support and appreciation from collectors and appreciators throughout the country and the world. Most recently, I won the Tom Tom Founder Festival Lamppost Banner Competition, winning a lamppost display on the outdoor walking mall of Charlottesville, VA.
My devotion is to the Arts and enhancing the world culture. I was blessed to have a private investor in the year of 2014. With his help I was able to obtain the supplies I needed to frame 14 large works and drive them from Virginia to California (I framed the works and transported them myself in July of 2014). The opening night of the exhibition was July 25th, 2014. I had the honor of sharing the opening with international phenom-Clive Barker. It was a lot of work but with the support of friends and family I met the deadline, and the dream became a reality. 
My investor's support ended December 31st, 2014. He helped me get off the ground and I am supremely grateful to him. I have received extremely positive feedback on my work from collectors in many demographics, selling over $5,000 in artwork last year. However, without your help, maintaining my current momentum will not be manageable. Please help me continue creating art that, I hope, the entire world will appreciate for centuries to come. 
   What I Need & What You Get The money raised in this campaign will go to studio space, art supplies (canvas, paint, and brushes), gas to get to and from my studio (it is 50 miles from my home), wood to build frames (as aforementioned I build my own - wood shop also 50 miles from my home). If I make the goal, I will  also purchase a new GoPro camera to create another time-lapse video like the one featured above. I no longer have the use of the camera we used to film the above video. With your help, we will make art history.
By supporting this campaign you will be actively enhancing the culture of the world, you will be playing a role in art history, and you will be supporting the passion of a soul devoted to the arts. ... But that is not all...
If you donate to this campaign I will send you a signed print of original art. Also, all contributors will receive a Special Thanks credit on future time-lapse videos (if we reach our goal). 
Whatever funds I receive from this campaign, be it the goal or far from it, will directly go into creating art! 
    

    Other Ways You Can Help
I understand that not everybody can contribute money. Please, take a moment to share this with your friends and family using the share tools provided. Art and culture are what make life unique and beautiful! Thank you for your time, support, and above all your appreciation of the arts. Sincerely,
Adam 'AD' Disbrow
"When nothing is sacred and nothing is safe, art is brave."

story:
"A Beacon of Light"

The Agora Borealis opened it's doors last July with the hope of bringing together some of the most creative and ambitious artists. Those involved are moved by the vibrant culture and history of Shreveport and are constantly on the look-out to make the town more welcoming to visitors. Hanging somewhere between Texas pride and raggin' Cajuns, Shreveport tends to shine it's own unique light in the South. When thinking of home here, we are flooded with images of ingenuity and flair! We are consistently inspired by those who unabashedly set free their creative style.

After considering these qualities, our imagination created a sort of "beacon of light" for those in search of a place to express themselves. Like the moth, we are captivated by the brilliance of Shreveport's innovation and charm. It is in these images that we feel there is potential to paint a landscape and illuminate our city's identity. Artwork is currently being drawn that we hope will spark further interest and excitement. Expect more to be revealed in Phase 3 of our project!


Meet Nicholas Bustamante

"I am drawn to spaces and items that hold within them the evidence of time. Structures that at one time functioned, but now are broken down to mere shadows of what they once had been. I use these structures as a stage to recreate a narrative history for these places." - N. Bustamante

The Agora Borealis has big dreams to invite well-respected artist Nicholas Bustamante to Shreveport!  Nicholas currently lives and works in Ruston where he teaches as an associate professor of art at Louisiana Tech University. Many of his students have successfully applied his teachings in Shreveport's local art scene! He has recently been working on an art installation in Monroe, Louisiana. See the progress of his mural located at Luna Blue Yoga Center, 428 Desiard Street. We're confident he would be the right person for the job!

Check out how progress is made by visiting https://monroemural.wordpress.com/

You can see more of Nicholas Bustamante's work on his website at www.bustamanteart.com

- OR -

Visit the Agora Borealis to see the concept art of the "Finding Home" mural in Monroe, LA. You can also purchase one of his prints to take home with you!


The Agora Phases

We've chosen to do 3 phases to help raise funds for this project. Feel free to contact the store and ask about details, dates, and other questions or concerns.

421 Lake Street, Shreveport, LA (318) 268-3011

PHASE 1 - Permits & Concept Art
Goal: $1000 (reached $505)
Deadline: 30 days

PHASE 2 - Supplies & Equipment
Goal: $2000
Deadline: 45 days

PHASE 3 - Labor & Completion
Goal: $3000
Deadline: 60 days

Risks & Challenges

LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!! We are currently scouting for a possible new location downtown to beautify. Kansas City Southern Railroad has not granted us permission to paint on the Marshall Street bridge (as of yet) for safety reasons. HOWEVER, we are still determined to turn our vision for downtown Shreveport into reality. We hope to have stations ready and paint in hand this coming June! Other duties include prepping the environment and deep cleaning to prepare for priming! We will also require heavy duty equipment such as scaffolding or a lift to ensure safety for our artists. Hours of organizing, scheduling, and painting the mural itself. Last step will be sealing and finishing effects to make sure it will withstand the elements of time.

PLEASE NOTE: This project can only be completed if all phases are successful by May, 2015. Otherwise, funds collected will be safety tucked away for a later attempt.

Helping Hands

We know that pockets aren't always deep and sometimes all you can give is your time and energy. There will be a sign-up sheet available for anyone who wants to volunteer their efforts for the cause! Also, if anyone would like to graciously feed or offer supplies for the artist crew, we would love to schedule a day with you to help make it happen! Our experience thus far, with our neighbors and friends of Shreveport/Bossier City have been nothing less than kind, and heart-warming. Thank you for all you're generosity!

story:
I am a painter , printmaker with over 40 years of developing and creating a style that is most personal in nature , I studied Fine Arts In Boston in the early 70's and since then I have shown in restaurants , museums , galleries , my work is in private and public collections .

 1000 people are expected to visit the Montreal Yes Art Expo and this funding will allow me to present my work in a professional manner . You never know who is going to show up

  • Help me make my work stand out
  • This will be the first ever showing of  my Linocut prints dating from 2009 with over 70 in total


What I Need & What You Get


  • I need $ 1000.00 to have over 70 pieces of works on paper and Linocuts shrink wrapped and matted so they will look presentable
  • One FREE linocut 15"X11" , one free postcard 
  • If I don't reach my total goal of shrink wrapping 70 prints I will use the funds to wrap  with whatever amount I have , but I need enough work to be sold over a three day period

The Impact

My deserves to be seen as I have my own " voice "  I don't follow trends or copy other artists works .  It is personal and reflects a long history of working on different series in different mediums . A lot of this work will be the first time out of my studio 

  • Get a preview of my new series titled " From print to canvas "
  • See abstract works never seen before
  • Get a glimpse of the artists eye and emotions

Risks & Challenges


  • What risks ? You have nothing to loose 
  • Help support your local artist

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please help me out with this short term project 
  • Please share with friends even if you don't contribute to my campaign

And that's all there is to it.

Here I am re-carving a linocut to use as a stamp

story:
Short Summary

My name is Joe Riso.  I’m an artist/ Painter living in Portland Oregon and I'm raising funds to go to  a painting seminar in Italy for 3 weeks from July4th-26th. In this study course students will work intensely under Two Teachers ~ focusing all their efforts into two panels that reflect a profound grasp of the master technique, "MischTechnik": More information about the seminar : http://www.lcaruana.com/webtext/lcmh.seminar.html  This Seminar will help take my painting to new levels so that In return  create exquisite works for viewers like you .   I'm offering quality goods as an exchange for your contribution! 

What I Need

Total funds needed for professional Art development $6,500

  • Plane, train,and bus tickets to and from Torri Superiore Italy $2,500

  • The cost of the program package including room and board = $2610

  • Passport =$165

  • Deposit=$500

  • Supplies=$100

  • $625=cost of living to maintain  house rent, phone, utilities  while away.

  • What You Get

     Every donation has it's perk.  There are several options for people to receive  gifts in exchange for their contribution.  As an artist making a living off of my art, I'm supported by my community.  In a way, my community directs the development of the art I produce.  Art is not complete until it's viewed by others, and it's my goal to produce the best quality work I'm capable of for the viewers.   Your contribution will help bring higher standards, diversity, quality, and experience to the Art I produce for art appreciators like you.

  • $5 contribution-  Every contribution, no matter the amount, will receive a special thank you email. 
  • $15 contribution-  You will receive a high-resolution digital image of one of my paintings via email.  Perfect for printing and framing!
  • $25 contribution-  You will receive a high-resolution digital image of a painting and a blank greeting card featuring a Riso Art image.  Great for giving to someone to show your appreciation!
  • $33 contribution-  You will receive an 8x8 Refrigerator magnet  with an image of my recent Shiva Dance painting. 
  • $50 contribution-  You will receive a signed print of one of my paintings mailed directly to your home.
  • $100 contribution-  You will receive a signed print, mounted on painted wood and varnished, as well as a blank greeting card featuring a Riso Art image.
  • $500  contribution- You will receive a framed 16 x20 original painting in signature Riso Art style.
  • $1,000 contribution- The Riso Art bundle!  1 Framed 16 x20 original painting.  1 signed print mounted on painted wood and varnished.  10 greeting cards featuring Riso Art.  The whole package!

The Vision

This will have a profound impact on my art, teaching and my personal life experience. To be able to Explore old masters techniques in the lush Mediterranean Ecovillaggio Torri Superiore. Italy,  rich in Art and family history, and  the perfect place to cultivate Art Spirit with a mature student mind ready to learn.  My Professional Art career as a painter is relatively new only 3 years deep, and one year as a beginner painting Instructor. I am planning on really taking in the experience and sharing it with the community through my new  learned techniques. 

Risks & Challenges

It is obviously a risk that I may not reach my goal, so I've decided  If I don't reach my goal in time,   I will  continue to show my progress and raise money till I do reach my goal. So that I can secure a spot the following year. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share this campaign, with your community!  Thank you so much!

story:
Bref résumé

Diplômé en peinture auto et fasciné par le monde de la kustom kulture depuis tout petit, c'est logiquement que j'ai monté en juillet 2015 mon atelier custom sur Pau. Ce type d'atelier n'est pas très développé ici, c'est pourquoi j'ai décidé de m'implanter. Ainsi chaque demande pourra être étudiée et recevra toute mon attention. Le but étant que vous ne soyez pas forcés de parcourir la France entière pour trouver votre bonheur.
J'ai également conscience que ce type de travail coûte très cher en général et c'est pourquoi je veux le rendre accessible au plus grand nombre en pratiquant des tarifs abordables pour chacun!

 Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

 Le bon lancement de mon entreprise nécessite un apport de base pour que je puisse acheter du matériel de qualité et louer un local ayant une superficie correcte afin de séparer la partie préparation et la partie peinture, pour rendre des éléments propres et un travail de qualité.

Bien sûr chaque personne qui aidera ce projet se verra récompensé! Stickers, t-shirts et sweats, tarifs revus à la baisse sur un projet, voir (à hauteur de l'aide fournie) un projet 100% offert!

Si mon projet n'atteint pas le plafond fixé, les fonds iront dans l'achat du matériel qui me permettra déjà de fournir un travail plus propre et plus rapide.

 Risques et défis

La grosse difficulté de ce type d'entreprise est de se faire connaître et apprécier. C'est pourquoi une page a été créée sur un célèbre réseau social. Page sur laquelle mes travaux terminés et en cours sont exposé, étapes par étapes, afin que chacun puisse juger du travail effectué. Ce type d'atelier fonctionne essentiellement par vue sur des rassemblements. Chaque moto peinte sera vue à droite ou à gauche, et pourra susciter des questions sur sa provenance. Ce qui aidera l'atelier à se faire connaître d'avantage et à avoir de plus en plus de clients.

 D'autres façons d'aider

 Si vous ne pouvez aider financièrement, un coup de pub ne peut me faire que du bien! Un partage en ligne, quelques mots à vos amis et connaissances feront toujours parler de mon travail et m'aideront à avancer dans mon projet.

Je vous remercie toutes et tous par avance de l'attention et de l'aide quelle qu'elle soit, que vous pourrez apporter à ce projet qui me tient à cœur depuis bien longtemps!

story:
ANALOG TO DIGITAL (Phase II)

Introduction and Goals

I am a multi-media artist who has been engaged in pioneering work with interactive systems and video installation since the early nineteen-eighties. You can learn more about me here: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miroslaw_Rogala.

Over the past thirty years, I have accumulated a vast video library, an archive of my work dating back to the early years of video. Aside from the amount of space this takes up and the cost of storage, I am concerned about preserving this work for the future and about transferring it to a format that is compatible with present-day equipment so I can continue to share it with the public.

The cost (and risk) of sending these tapes out to a production house for transfer is steep and prohibitive. What I propose instead is to purchase the equipment necessary for the transfer and to hire one or two assistants to aid me with this enormous task. I am estimating that the initial cost will be around twenty thousand dollars, which is the amount I am hoping to raise and the reason I am asking for your support. 

Why This is Important

This project is about historic preservation. Work that I have archived in my library documents some of the earliest experiments combining video with computers to create viewer interactive installations. These date back to a time when many of the applications we take for granted today had not been invented and programming skills were required to produce the most basic effects. 

I also want to preserve my collaborations with other artists. For example, I have hours of tape documenting Chicago Imagist painter Ed Paschke working in his studio as well as interviews with him and other rare footage. I have also worked with Carolee Schneemann, Merce Cunningham, Shigeko Kubota and many other artists, performers and musicians, all captured on tape in my library. I even have unpublished footage of Czeslaw Niemen, the iconic singer who is as revered in Poland as Elvis is in the United States.

Over the years I have created over three hundred analog video tapes in several different formats, the most popular being 8mm, Betamax SP and ¾” SP and non-SP. To hire professionals to digitize these tapes costs over $100 per hour not including transportation costs, if the playback equipment to do the job is even available. What’s worse, the tapes themselves are fragile and will eventually deteriorate. My early tapes are getting close to their expiration date, so I am in a race with time to digitize the archive before it is lost forever. 

Transferring this treasure trove of analog material to digital media will also make it accessible to new generations of viewers, researchers and art historians. My ultimate goal is to set up a digital database that includes metadata that can be shared with museums, libraries and other institutions worldwide.

Rewards for DonorsDonors will receive valuable premiums: signed DVDs of video and multi-media work or signed and numbered digital prints. Some of the larger pieces will be printed on canvas; each uniquely altered with acrylic paint and signed.

Please Share

You can also help by sharing this with friends, acquaintances and with anyone who is a fan of cutting-edge digital artwork. Thank you!

To hire professionals to digitize these tapes costs over $100 per hour not including transportation costs, if the playback equipment to do the job is even available. What’s worse, the tapes themselves are fragile and will eventually deteriorate. My early tapes are getting close to their expiration date, so I am in a race with time to digitize the archive before it is lost forever. Transferring this treasure trove of analog material to digital media will also make it accessible to new generations of viewers, researchers and art historians. My ultimate goal is to set up a digital database that includes metadata that can be shared with museums, libraries and other institutions worldwide.Rewards for DonorsDonors will receive valuable premiums: signed DVDs of video and multi-media work or signed and numbered digital prints. Some of the larger pieces will be printed on canvas; each uniquely altered with acrylic paint and signed.Please ShareYou can also help by sharing this with friends, acquaintances and with anyone who is a fan of cutting-edge digital artwork. Thank you!

story:
A regular comment we were hearing from our friends in the Macon arts community was along the lines of, “I wish there was a place where I could just hang out and work on my projects and meet more of the other artists around here.”  Most people don’t have easy access to the space or environment where they can work on their craft.  Our homes are crowded and full of the distractions of obligation and habitual living.  Once we’re out of college, where can we go for daily studio access or an environment where script read-throughs and music composition are welcome instead of out-of-place?

Monthly meetings of art clubs are definitely helpful for maintaining some focus and connecting with fellow artists and crafters, but they do not meet often enough or long enough for the advancement of serious projects.  Not all media are supported by local clubs, either.  What if we had a club for everyone?  What if that club was open six days a week and for 10-12 hours each day?  What if you had the space to work comfortably, enjoy refreshments and build an arts community? 

What if we had a place to feature our works and perform and network?  What about a place where we can go for workshops and collaboration?  What if we had an arts guild and our own guild hall?

Starting in the spring of 2016, we will have all of these things in the [&] Guild and [&] Guild Hall!

[&] ampersand arts was founded in June 2014 as a family arts business and collaborative outreach to other local artists.  We have steadily grown since then and originally intended to open an arts retail space in Macon.  As we approached the time to seriously look at a space for our retail store, we kept coming back to the constant questions about community and opportunity. 

We decided a few months ago that we would shift our efforts from a small network of artists to a home for all artists.  The plan changed from a small storefront, to a 5000 sq. ft. space on the corner of 5th and Poplar.  Our dream has always been to approach the art market as a collaborative and invest what we can in the overall community.  Our 5-year plan started with visual arts, crafts and creative writing, with the intention to expand into performance arts and festivals, but we have revised our plan to emphasize the empowerment of all artists and the production and financial support to grow the arts community in the region. 

So far, we have committed over $40,000 of funds from [&] ampersand arts.  Since the new direction of the [&] Guild and [&] Guild Hall is much larger in scope than our original collaborative and small storefront, this Indiegogo Campaign has become necessary to finish the start-up support we need for the guild members and the full diversity of arts media.  The success of this project will be helped tremendously by not having to wait on a year’s capital savings, in order to finally get the better equipment.  We need a much larger pool of micro-grant funds, to support a wide variety of local artist projects.  We are doing a membership drive, to help start out of the gate with a level of involvement that will more quickly engage a larger community.  We need greater awareness of the existence of the [&] Guild and the opening of the [&] Guild Hall.

How can you help?

1)  Share our campaign!  Even if people are not able to support this project financially, we greatly benefit from spreading the word.  Outreach to the artists and supporters of the arts is a major project itself, so any help we can get goes a long way.

2)  Sign up for your membership now, and receive bonus perks!  Access to the [&] Guild Hall is not limited to members.  The main space is also open to the public, to appreciate the products of our members and enjoy the environment.  Members have access to the studio space, and we are able to keep the space open for members after the public hours are closed.  Members also have discounts on purchases from art supplies, the café and retail space.  Details on membership are featured below and on our site here: www.ampersandguild.com/join/.  During this campaign, you can start your first month or first year of membership in the [&] Guild!

3)  Support the Artists!  Patrons, Supporters and Sponsors invest in a real future for local artists and the resources that the [&] Guild and [&] Guild Hall are able to provide.  We have the space and the basics to open and operate, but we need your help to provide some of the missing pieces and enhance the quality of the equipment we’ll use to support the creative production, presentation and performance of the arts.

Please contact us if you have any questions about this campaign or about [&] ampersand arts and our new adventure with the [&] Guild and [&] Guild Hall.  info@ampersand-arts.com


**Fellow memberships are subject to portfolio review.
Please contact Becca to request a portfolio review meeting.**

story:
Beyond the Known Territory

I've long been fascinated by the unconscious and how it appears in art. Years ago while I was living in the island city of Alameda CA, a mysterious figure started appearing in my paintings. Then one day on the way to work, in a flash, words came to me connected with that figure. It was the beginning of an ongoing graphic narrative: Indigo Animal. 

The strips piled up and became one book, then a second—both self-published. The first spent some time on the San Francisco Bay Area Best Seller list. From the beginning, Indigo Animal has also serialized in the arts journal works & conversations. And now, after a journey of over 20 years, I’m publishing the complete story from its beginning to its concluding third book.

Indigo Animal: The Complete Trilogy is a book difficult to categorize. Is it a graphic novel? Is it a book for children? Is it a book for Jungian psychotherapists? Is it a book for artists who struggle with the contemporary art world and its reliance on spectacle and conceptual conceits? Yes, it’s all of that. But none of those categories really capture its essence.

Why Support Us

I hope my project will inspire people to find and follow their own “inner animals.” It’s a kind of alchemical process. The unfolding of Indigo Animal's passionate pursuit of self-knowledge (and lawn statuary) has been a life-enhancing journey. Sharing the story is a new step along the way.

What We Need

Having Indigo Animal's entire story under one cover has long been our dream. It’s now a reality and ready to send out. With this campaign we're hoping to share indigo Animal's message with more people and get help covering some of the costs. The book is beautiful—full color, 320-pages, hardcover. We're also working to arrange events and related workshops. Please check out our perks. Share Indigo Animal The Complete Trilogy on social media with your friends and check out the Indiegogo share tools. Your support will be a real help! Thank you so much!

Ceramic pendant handcrafted by artist Rue Harrison

Indigo Animal studying classical systems of proportion

Indigo Animal's mind opening up to a wider perspective

story:
Summary

Beautiful Mount Airy Lodge is a fascinating look at the history of America’s favorite vacation spot in the Poconos.

The book is illustrated with hundreds of full color photographs, archival brochures, and historic news clippings. It features exclusive information collected from interviews with past guests and employees and full color photographs of the historic Mount Airy Lodge.

Mount Airy Lodge promised a dazzling, fun-filled vacation with outstanding nonstop entertainment. ''All you need to bring is your love for everything,'' went the voice-over, ending with the mellifluous ''Your Host With the Most in the Poconos. Beautiful Mount Airy Lodge.''

Why We Want To Make This Book

We want to create this book to capture the fascinating history of the Mount Airy Lodge and to celebrate it’s many years as America’s premier honeymoon resort. 

As it changed and grew over the years, people marvelled at Czech born owner and hostess, Suzanne Martens, who transformed the little eight-room inn into the Poconos' largest resort which comprised several resorts sprawling over thousands of acres.

Many will remember the dining filled with epicurean delights and entertainment which included names such as Bob Hope, Milton Berle, Rodney Dangerfield, Tony Bennett, Alan King, Connie Francis, Nipsey Russell, Vic Damone, Joey Bishop, Phyllis Diller, Pat Boone,Lionel Hampton, Eddie Fisher, Wayne Newton, Vikki Carr, Red Skelton, and Don Rickles.

Parties were hosted for the who's who at the time - Wayne Newton, Rudy Vallee and Frank Sinatra Jr. just to name a few.

The Mount Airy Lodge also sponsored many Czech and Slovak immigrants. Our grandparents and mother were among the Czechs that arrived to live and work at the Mount Airy Lodge and owner/host Emil Wagner received several medals for his humanitarian efforts.

Few people know how Mount Airy Lodge began and what an impossible undertaking such a project would be today.

From Czech and Slovak roots and an immigrant dream, to one of the most glitzy and glamourous places

"In its heyday in the 1960's and 70's, Mount Airy Lodge, only a 90-minute drive from Manhattan, was unofficially known as the gentile version of the Catskills' Concord Hotel, a place that featured polka festivals, all-Irish weekends and all-you-can-eat smorgasbords."

-Andrew Jacobs

The Story that Needs To Be Told

Not just for the nostalgic value but for all of the following:

  • Advertising and Marketing to make it the #1 honeymoon resort in its heyday.
  • A lesson in hard work, vision and the entrepreneurial spirit.
  • What lessons can be learned from a rise and decline, and changing times.

The Research

At this time we have over 250+ images, two dozen brochures, letters and advertising materials and over 50 hours of taped interviews with past guests, employees and friends of the owners. The scanning, transcribing and conversions are almost complete.

We'd like to travel to the Poconos to visit the county archives and interview more people that are in the area and have more to share. 10% of the campaign funding goal is to make those arrangements and cover the cost for the final research for the book.

The Printing

Printing a book is a costly venture, especially when the book is full color, on heavy paper and bound in a hard cover. 90% of the campaign funds we are seeking is to do a 1,500 book print run of the book.

The Perks & Rewards

We've created perks and rewards (to the right) where you can be a part of the story! No matter what your budget, we're sure you can contribute and you may even be in the book! 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out.
  • Make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the convenient Indiegogo share tools.
  • Tell all of your friends.

We look forward to bringing the story of the beautiful Mount Airy Lodge to the world, so THANK YOU in advance for all of your support!

story:
Short Summary

  Nkyinkyim is an  art Installation/monument which will be made of a wall-like structure which bears relief sculptures as well as sculptures in- the -round (out- door theatre) that will tell stories of our Ghanaian/African ancestors.

  • My name is Kwame Akoto-Bamfo, I am the creator of the Nkyinkyim installation concept and I have recently partnered with the Ghana Museums and Monuments Board through my art company Osramba, to make this project a reality.
  • Nkyinkyim is part of a larger project called Ancestor Project; which is a conscious effort to educate and rekindle youth interest in African heritage/history. Although I have many supporters I am currently the sole financier of all Ancestor Project activities and the Nkyinkyim art installation.
  • I am an artist and a former lecturer at Radford University College. During my active years as a lecturer I served as a visiting artist/Lecturer at National Film and Television Institute (Ghana), Lincoln community school and College of Art -Kwame Nkrumah University of Science and Technology. 

So far I have a little over 530 cement heads  (with a lot of help from my assistants and friends).
The land for the installation has already been given by the Nuhale traditional council ,to be precise, the Adibiawe family .


What We Need & What You Get

  • We estimate that the Nkyinkyim installation will take approximately seven years to complete.We (my assistants and I) will need approximately 1 Million dollars spread over the seven year period,however, we need $203,240 to continue what we have started at our present studio. The moneys will be used to :
    1. Setup studio (with 4 shared sleeping areas for artists) with electricity and water supply-$67,245. 
    2. Materials and equipment to complete the first 1000 figures (full bodies) of the  installation-$ 45,300.
    3. Bring  aboard more artist and extra hands-$56,657.
    4. Research ,pertaining to the project (being as historically accurate as possible is an essential part of the art) -$34,038.


    • In exchange for your help, if you choose one of our perks, you will receive original handmade art works from the artists and also you stand a chance to having your portrait used as one of the sculptures!
    • Even if we do not reach our goal, the moneys we get will be used to create as many sculptures as possible.

    Each perk is hand made and thus may vary slightly from the pictures shown. Please be patient with the perk delivery because each perk is hand made only by myself and my fellow artist.




      The Impact

         The installation will educate Africans and people all over the world about African history and heritage. The monument will serve to remind all Africans about the importance of being united. For a long time our stories as Africans have been told in bits and pieces, whilst generally ignoring the bigger picture. This, however, has led to a lot of tribal conflict in a lot of African countries.
        • Much of African history is based on oral traditions and although much has been done over the years to record and teach this to young Africans, I feel a monument of this sort will give a holistic idea about our roots with emphasis on what makes us unique but united as opposed to what makes us different. 
        • Nkyinkyim is NOT entirely about the trans-Atlantic and Sub-Saharran slave trades, but also about diverse culture, history and heritage of the African people. It will educate Africans who have lost their roots about Africa before the trans-Atlantic slave trade.
        • Setting up studio on site at Nuhale, means that artists get to be closer to the Nuhale community and also get to involve them in the project, thus the youth from the community get to learn directly by being involved.

        Risks & Challenges

        I understand that this project is very ambitious, I said that before I started work on the the first head-now we have 530 and counting in 16 months.

        I have decided to dedicate my life to completing this project, however it is a herculean task and I will need help to finish this project. I have decided to build the sculptures in phases. Already the first phase of the project is underway with well over 530 heads. This phase spans a 2 year period by which end a 1000 sculpted figures will be built to completion. I hope the impact made by the first 1000 figures will help me get more funds to complete the the project.

        Your contributions will have a huge impact on completing this project. Please contribute. No amount is too little.

        Other Ways You Can Help

        Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

        • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
        • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools! And share share share! To art enthusiasts  and everyone!
        • Help us with research!:Join Ancestor Project!
