story:
Summary

Art Temple is both a sanctuary and playground for your wild mind. It is a gathering place for creators of all levels to get better at what they do. Staffed by professional and compassionate artists, musicians, dreamers and creators of the highest caliber, Art Temple offers classes, workshops, programs, panel discussions, one on one training and many other opportunities for people to connect more deeply to their own true source. 

Born from a desire to see people become more active and creative in their own lives, Art Temple has gathered world class creators to bring their visionary talents to help people ground their conference, workshop and festival experience in enlightened self expression. When people create for themselves, they learn. We turn a spectator into a participant, and that makes all the difference in the world for them.

In these strange and unwieldy times, it is profound acts of creativity that will save the world. What you have in mind and in your heart matters. We are here to help you bring it out. Art Temple is meant for you. Come to Art Temple and feel free.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the breakdown:

  • We need about $6000 to create the infrastructure for Art Temple to be self sustaining for the rest of the Spring and Summer. This includes a spectacular pavilion designed by Dave Zaboski. Along with some new amazing drawing benches and art materials so we can fully be of service to you.
  • We need a trailer to hold all our benches, flooring, tent and other materials so we can travel. If you have a  good enclosed 6x10 trailer to donate or would like to help us get one, we welcome your contribution!
  • We have world class artists and creators involved. They also need support to continue brining their genius to the world. Their stuff is so dope you gotta have it!

The Impact

  • We are a small and growing operation. Every dollar helps build our infrastructure of benches, tent, flooring, lights and allows us to serve you.
  • This is our tenth festival with Art Temple. We're here to stay and growing better every day. 
  • Every great crisis this world has ever faced has been solved by profound acts of creativity. We are a champion of creative endeavors. Helps us save the world! Donate now!

Risks & Challenges

We know these are strange and difficult times. But we believe a better future starts with telling powerful creative stories now. We believe we can take Art Temple to places it's never been and help tell a new story to the world. This is something that has never been done, so we are breaking new ground. We are betting that the world needs more collaboration, more connectivity and more creativity. And we're not exactly sure how to get there. All we can do is the next honest thing.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help. You can:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about our Art Temple campaign!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
Summary
Art Temple is both a sanctuary and playground for your wild mind. It is a gathering place for creators of all levels to get better at what they do. Staffed by professional and compassionate artists, musicians, dreamers and creators of the highest caliber, Art Temple offers classes, workshops, programs, panel discussions, one on one training and many other opportunities for people to connect more deeply to their own true source. 
Born from a desire to see people become more active and creative in their own lives, Art Temple has gathered world class creators to bring their visionary talents to help people ground their conference, workshop and festival experience in enlightened self expression. When people create for themselves, they learn. We turn a spectator into a participant, and that makes all the difference in the world for them.
In these strange and unwieldy times, it is profound acts of creativity that will save the world. What you have in mind and in your heart matters. We are here to help you bring it out. Art Temple is meant for you. Come to Art Temple and feel free.
 

What We Need & What You Get
Here's the breakdown:

We need about $6000 to create the infrastructure for Art Temple to be self sustaining for the rest of the Spring and Summer. This includes a spectacular pavilion designed by Dave Zaboski. Along with some new amazing drawing benches and art materials so we can fully be of service to you.
We need a trailer to hold all our benches, flooring, tent and other materials so we can travel. If you have a  good enclosed 6x10 trailer to donate or would like to help us get one, we welcome your contribution!
We have world class artists and creators involved. They also need support to continue brining their genius to the world. Their stuff is so dope you gotta have it!


The Impact

We are a small and growing operation. Every dollar helps build our infrastructure of benches, tent, flooring, lights and allows us to serve you.
This is our tenth festival with Art Temple. We're here to stay and growing better every day. 
Every great crisis this world has ever faced has been solved by profound acts of creativity. We are a champion of creative endeavors. Helps us save the world! Donate now!


Risks & Challenges
We know these are strange and difficult times. But we believe a better future starts with telling powerful creative stories now. We believe we can take Art Temple to places it's never been and help tell a new story to the world. This is something that has never been done, so we are breaking new ground. We are betting that the world needs more collaboration, more connectivity and more creativity. And we're not exactly sure how to get there. All we can do is the next honest thing.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help. You can:

Help us get the word out and make some noise about our Art Temple campaign!
Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
The American Renaissance Tarot

 

Who we are

Hi, my name is Thea Wirsching and I have a PhD in American literature.  I'm also an astrologer, ordained priestess, and general practitioner of the Hermetic arts, and I've combined my two loves (literature and magic) into a Tarot deck about nineteenth-century American writers.   

I was so lucky to find the amazingly talented artist Celeste Pille to illustrate my vision, and since contracting with her she has completed thirty Tarot card images, almost forty percent of the project!  But a standard Tarot deck contains seventy-eight unique images, and so we have a long road ahead in terms of compensating the artist for her time, skill, and care in attending to the rich detail that goes into each image.  

 

Where the money will go

Our goal of $3,900 reflects Celeste's fee per image and the forty-eight cards that remain to be illustrated (plus the percentage of the campaign that goes to Indiegogo, and our cost for prints and postage).  Even if we do not reach our goal, any money we receive will contribute directly to the completion of the project.  Once Celeste has completed all seventy-eight images for The American Renaissance Tarot, we will seek representation by a publisher or begin the process of self-publishing the deck.  The American Renaissance Tarot will ultimately become a physical deck of cards with accompanying book (already written by me) about the thirty-six writers included in the project.      

 

Why this project is important

Believe it or not, no Tarot deck about American history has ever been attempted before.  The American Renaissance Tarot yokes the compelling history of the Civil War and slavery's abolition with the intricacies of America's first literary renaissance.  By telling these interrelated stories of mid-nineteenth century America with striking images and potent symbolism, I believe we can introduce a wide audience to America's deep traditions of political activism, social consciousness-raising, philosophical inquiry, and metaphysical experimentation.  As a culturally inclusive deck celebrating particularly American forms of syncretism, The American Renaissance Tarot aims to reflect the liberal values that have always been a feature of our shared history.   

 

Other ways you can help

If you are intrigued by the project but are unable to make a contribution today, we ask that you please support us by liking our Facebook page and sharing our content widely.  You can view additional images from The American Renaissance Tarot on Facebook and also at our website, www.americanrenaissancetarot.com.  We will keep you up to date on our progress with regular blog postings, and we will continue to share select Tarot images as they are created.  Your support is a key factor in showing publishers that there is a demand for a culturally informed and visually exciting project such as this.

Thanks for reading.  We're so happy you're here.

Thea and Celeste

story:
My goal in life is to create art that sustains the test of time. Two years ago I came up with the idea to merchandise my photography and video brand and I've had amazing support amongst the community. 

In two years I've established Bossin INC as a reputable brand in my community, hosting several events including fashion shows, pop up shops and we were even able to be apart of a women's flag football game where we raised over $2,000 for children for school books. 

Never in a million years could I have imagined I would receive the type of support I have. This is part of my mission in life. Not just to create clothing but to be an example for a young kid out there and show them that whatever you believe you can achieve. 

Growing up there weren't that many examples of entrepreneurs around me, My only knowledge of buying clothing was from department stores and things of that nature. One thing that changed me and motivated me was seeing the reaction of the kids when they find out I am the one that designed the clothing. That means more than money itself.

I am starting this campaign with a goal to raise $10,000 for the brand. With this money I will be able to hire staff, pay for an office space and bring some of the creations in my head to life. 

I would like to thank you for taking the time to read this and also thank you in advance for sharing this campaign and/or donating.  I hope you enjoy the video.

Blessings

story:
'Pachamama' is an Aymara and Quechua word commonly translated as 'Mother Earth.' Pachamama is a goddess, the source of life and death. Many believe that problems arise when people take too much from nature...

"When I was younger, I was told: you can't pursue art as a career,  my strong interest in the arts and film led me to a career as an Art Director, which I love and I am tremendously grateful for, but making an installation for Burning Man has always been a dream of mine. "

Juan Manuel Ramal, Pachamama Artist and Visionary.

Building this installation is no small feat, the scale of the sculpture will take weeks to build, the size will be approximately  40 feet long by 18 feet high. We have estimated around $20-25K to make this happen. We will try to fund the rest through fundraiser events.

The funding is required to cover the costs for:

  • Materials to make the sculpture
  • Equipment to light the installation
  • Transportation from LA to Black Rock City 

No doubt there will be some blood, sweat and tears, but often the best things in life are not easy.  

We invite you in supporting this work of art  by making a despacho (an offering) 

Donate $20 or more and receive a High Res PDF file of the Art rendering.

Donate $50 or more and receive a Chakana stone necklace.

Donate $1000 or more and receive a Chakana silver necklace and tickets to our fundraiser events.

In the unfortunate event that the full amount is not raised, we might have to settle making certain  parts, but hopefully it will not come to this!

All money raised will be used mindfully and spent directly on the art project.

"My job as an Art Director is fast paced with short time leads, every day I make other peoples visions happen. Pachamama is a passion project and I am excited about the opportunity and challenge of making this vision come to life and sharing with the citizens of Black Rock City. I hope it will stir emotions and inspire many souls on and off playa in a positive way"

It will take a village to make this happen, a small building team of hardworking reliable friends to help support the project donating their time and skills.

If you feel called to be part of Pachamama 2018, please feel free to reach out, come and help, offer support or advice. 

Please spread the 'munay' (universal feeling of love) by donating money (!) sharing this campaign with your community via Facebook or Instagram or old fashion conversation. 

 

With Love and Gratitude

 

Juan Manuel Ramal and Team Pachamama

Beginning of the head

story:
Hello my name is Joey Chavez, I'm the owner and artist of the Body Art Bus "west coasts first and only fully licensed mobile tattoo studio". Do not be deceived! this is not just another mobile tattoo studio. This is a virtual bridge, were tattoo artistry can be created and displayed anywhere. 

I have been tattooing for over 15 years, and graduated with a bachelors degree in illustration. My greatest accomplishment was the creation of the Body Art Bus. My artistic dream was to be able to tattoo anywhere legally and safe. Through rigorous trial and error and county bureaucracy the bus was created. 

The Body Art Bus has been in business now for over 7 years, and continues to grow. This last year we were able to obtain the first fully licensed mobile luxury bus (Body Art Bus 2). Our next goal is to take the bus Cross Country, and let the world see the future of tattooing. This is were we need your help. this trip is a lot more expensive then I thought for gas, lodging, and food. 

We have different perks depending on the size of your donation. Please help and make this dream come true.

story:
Word to Image - Musings on the Hebrew Alphabet

We live in a time when spiritual awareness is more important than it has ever been. 

"A bit of mystery, a bit of magic, a lot of mystical power melded to produce the Hebrew alphabet."

While learning the Hebrew alphabet, Woodstock Artist and Writer Renee Englander came to see the unique relationship between each Hebrew letter and their deeper kabbalistic meanings.

She created Word to Image's  gallery-quality paintings and then added her inspired haiku, to illustrate and inspire a deep understanding of their messages for us, and this beautiful book was born. We could not be more proud to share this project with the world.

Renee has decided to self-publish, so this pre-sale is designed help raise the funds needed for printing, production and distribution, while offering supporters the chance to purchase copies of Word to Image and  and at a discount. Additionally, this is the first ever opportunity for our supporters to directly purchase fine art prints, merchandise, and original paintings.

Support us, and be a part of the Word to Image project -- we would love to have you with us as we cross the finish line!

What will we do with the funds raised?

Publishing a book is an epic journey! For Word to Image, it began with an idea and then a very small printing of 25 prototypes. Renee immediately had to print more, just to meet local demand. The book has been created, and now we need help, to share its wisdom with the world.

The funding through this campaign covers the high-quality production of this book in paper and hardbound editions as well as complimentary art projects, but your involvement with our campaign will produce more than a book or art prints. The Hebrew alphabet's timeless wisdom is something you will absorb, treasure, and share with others. It is our goal to get this book into the hands of Jewish women and Hebrew students who might not otherwise find it, and to aid and enhance their lessons and learning of the materials.

If we reach and surpass the goal, we will continue to find new ways to  and get this book into even more hands!

 

How Can You Can Help Renee?

Order your Copy of Word to Image, or a Classroom Set of 12!

Choose a beautiful art print for your home or a deck of Wisdom Cards!

Share the word with your friends, who love the Hebrew alphabet and fine art.

Use your Indiegogo and social media to share this campaign.

Post to Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter for us! 

Send us your Love and Joy

story:
Short Summary
 

My name is Annalee Beer. I am an artist and designer living in Brisbane, Australia. I began my creative career in a serious way in 2015 after a period of cripping PTSD led me to a place where I couldn't work in a traditional format. Ever since then I have been working very seriously to turn my creative endeavours into an income. 

By supporting this campaign you are supporting a disabled artist to live an independant creative life.

What I Need & What You Get

It will cost me a good amount of money to host a solid exhibition. $1300 is planned for renting an exhibition space. $600 is required to get prints made of my work. A further $800 is for physical supplies and tools for art creation. The additional funds will help me to pay for catering, printing invitations and marketing. The exhibition will take place in November 2020.

Everybody who supports this campaign will receive some art - in one form or another. Every donation above $5 is eligible to receive a unique piece of art from my Brisbane City Postcard series. To be clear, the pictures attached to the backer rewards are samples of past postcards. Each postcard sent for this campaign will be a new and unique image.

It is my plan to go ahead with the exhibition, whether or not I make all of the money in this campaign. It would just require a very slow process of saving my income.

The Impact

It would mean an awful lot to me to receive help to reach this goal. Creating a career as a fine artist is such a hard thing to do, and moving towards a place where I can develop a meaningful career creating fine art would change my life in a major way. 

It will also contribute to the art scene in Brisbane, Australia.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to contribute financially, please consider sharing this campaign.

story:
Political Stencil

 

We are “Political Stencil”, a team of artists and activists, active in the urban landscapes of Athens and abroad.

Commentating is our force of action. We keep our focus on sociopolitical issues and actively engage in bashing fascist, sexist and racist views. We stand against austerity policies and any form of state repression.

It is the political and social momentum that moves us. Each case and incident we choose to act upon is individual and in some form mirrors issues deeply rooted in our society.

Our revenues come solely from our work. Our first, self-published edition brought us up to here. Now we are trying to collect the funds for our second, enhanced edition which will contain five years of our work.

 

What We Need & What You Get


We need the funding in order to print our five-year,  limited edition publication.
We are planning to sell this publication so we can keep financing our project and remain independent from the need of receiving funds that will put our freedom of expression into risk.

Selling our books is our only means of financing and we ask for your help to keep going.

In order to support our campaign, you can either preorder our catalogue or purchase a handmade T-shirt, stenciled with one of our works.

 

The Impact

 

Humor, sarcasm, exaggeration and linguistic distortion are our tools against mass media propaganda. Officially we are vandals, since unauthorized graffiti is characterized as such. We accept the term and insist with what we do but we retain the notion that we are vandals with a certain air and an opinion that is worth to be heard.

Help us keep going!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Some people just can't contribute, we understand that and that's perfectly ok. But if you like what we do, please share it so other people might know about our project.

Thank you!

story:
About the Artists

Morag Myersough & Luke Morgan X Ilukuluku.

Created exclusively for Afrika Burn 2019 by UK based Morag Myerscough and Luke Morgan who are known around the world for their distinct approach to making large scaffold structures adorned with neon geometric patterns and shapes, often incorporating positive messaging hand painted onto plywood. Their recent work includes "Embrace the Unknown" 2018 Cape Town, the Temple of Agape London 2014 and the Movement Café London 2012.

Morag’s mantra is ‘make happy those who are near and those who are far will come’. Morag has always been fascinated by how words, colour, pattern and structures can change environments and people’s perceptions of spaces into places. Luke is a non-conformist maverick inventor. His kinetic sculptures stem from a fascination with the way machines work and a deep love for rock n roll music and devotee of 50s aesthetic.

About the Ilukuluku Tribe

  • In its fourth year, the 40 strong tribe crew has formed a collective of talented creative individuals who are all working together to see this vision come to life. ILUKULUKU is registered collective, endorsed by AfrikaBurn. They are supported by a great number of tribe, friends and proud default world sponsors. Each and every one of them has committed to realising the vision of enhancing the effectiveness of Tankwa Town. Guided by the organisation’s 11 guiding principles, they uphold the ethos of the ‘Burner’ community and culture.

About the Perks

Morag Myerscough & Luke Morgan X Ilukuluku

All our perks features Morag Myerscough and Luke Morgan's custom patterns designed for Ilukuluku.

About the Ilukuluku Temple of Curiosity:

“The ILUKULUKU Temple of Curiosity aims to stimulate your curiosity and will offer an array of activities, interactions, performances and curious happenings” says Myerscough. “The Temple is a place of belonging. It is bold and proud and will max out your senses, generating specific responses in each individual who experiences the work, creating a community and building identity.”

What we are raising funds for:

  • We are raising funds to cover the material and transportation costs of the art structure including: 8 ton scaffolding, 330 X plywood panels, 550l paint, paint materials and basic operational fees. 
  • We have created unique rewards with our patterns to engage our participants to help us raise the temple off the ground.

The Impact

We are not going to burn our art structure, we will repurpose all the hand painted plywood panels and refurbish a local community school that burnt down in 2019 and reuse the panels for educational purposes.

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

  • Please share our crowdfunding campaign to your local community and friends.
  • Follow our social media pages and follow our journey to the dust!
  • Contact us at info@ilukuluku.co.za if you want to donate!

Thanks to YOU, the Ilukuluku - Temple of Curiosity at Afrika Biurn 2019 will see it's vision come to life!
story_txt:
About the Artists
Morag Myersough & Luke Morgan X Ilukuluku. 
Created exclusively for Afrika Burn 2019 by UK based Morag Myerscough and Luke Morgan who are known around the world for their distinct approach to making large scaffold structures adorned with neon geometric patterns and shapes, often incorporating positive messaging hand painted onto plywood. Their recent work includes "Embrace the Unknown" 2018 Cape Town, the Temple of Agape London 2014 and the Movement Café London 2012.
Morag’s mantra is ‘make happy those who are near and those who are far will come’. Morag has always been fascinated by how words, colour, pattern and structures can change environments and people’s perceptions of spaces into places. Luke is a non-conformist maverick inventor. His kinetic sculptures stem from a fascination with the way machines work and a deep love for rock n roll music and devotee of 50s aesthetic.
About the Ilukuluku Tribe
In its fourth year, the 40 strong tribe crew has formed a collective of talented creative individuals who are all working together to see this vision come to life. ILUKULUKU is registered collective, endorsed by AfrikaBurn. They are supported by a great number of tribe, friends and proud default world sponsors. Each and every one of them has committed to realising the vision of enhancing the effectiveness of Tankwa Town. Guided by the organisation’s 11 guiding principles, they uphold the ethos of the ‘Burner’ community and culture.

About the Perks
Morag Myerscough & Luke Morgan X Ilukuluku
All our perks features Morag Myerscough and Luke Morgan's custom patterns designed for Ilukuluku.

About the Ilukuluku Temple of Curiosity:
“The ILUKULUKU Temple of Curiosity aims to stimulate your curiosity and will offer an array of activities, interactions, performances and curious happenings” says Myerscough. “The Temple is a place of belonging. It is bold and proud and will max out your senses, generating specific responses in each individual who experiences the work, creating a community and building identity.”
What we are raising funds for:

We are raising funds to cover the material and transportation costs of the art structure including: 8 ton scaffolding, 330 X plywood panels, 550l paint, paint materials and basic operational fees. 
We have created unique rewards with our patterns to engage our participants to help us raise the temple off the ground.


The Impact
We are not going to burn our art structure, we will repurpose all the hand painted plywood panels and refurbish a local community school that burnt down in 2019 and reuse the panels for educational purposes.
 
Other Ways You Can Help:

Please share our crowdfunding campaign to your local community and friends.
Follow our social media pages and follow our journey to the dust!
Contact us at info@ilukuluku.co.za if you want to donate!

Thanks to YOU, the Ilukuluku - Temple of Curiosity at Afrika Biurn 2019 will see it's vision come to life!

story:
After countless hours weeks months and years I’ve finally decided to open up a Private Tattoo Studio. This facility will be my work place for both my business ventures in tattooing and custom oil painting. Chosen names for these said business’ is “The Parlor Private Tattoo Studio” and “Framed in Time Custom Oil Paintings”....At this time I’d like to invite my family , friends , clients etc to join me in helping this come to fruition. All donations will not go unnoticed and as incentive I’d like to offer discounted tattoos or a discounted oil painting of your choice....as much as 25% off if at least $50 is pledged. If you give way more than this I will go the mile helping you out achieve whatever piece you want and you paying as little as possible for that tattoo or painting. I will most definitely have your back if you can have mine right now.  God willing this endeavor falls perfectly in to place and things can get back to normal as soon as possible. Thank you in advance for your helping hand and I can’t wait to pay it forward. Cheers to the future and stay safe out there :) 

 

What the funds would go towards :

Final completion of the building

Purchase balance of the building 

Interior walls , wiring , flooring , A/C , paint and remaining interior design.

 

Again Thank you for your time and contribution...if you donate please reach out to me so we can set something up as soon as this project is up and running. :)

story:
My Story:

Hey there! My name is Alec Vaughan, and I have been wood crafting for a few months now. I have always had a knack for the creative, and have many years experience as a 3D artist. When quarantine happened I was furloughed from my job, and with nothing to do I decided to take on a hobby. I would have never guessed that this little hobby of mine would take off like it has. I bought a small lathe and already had some tools at my disposal and just started to carve, cut, sand, and turn out some wood. 

My campaign has a simple idea in mind. Getting exposure as a small business and in turn providing a product that you will own that is unique and true to you. I want to create a large order through the Indiegogo platform to help boost my small business. This is super important to me because my passion is to get this business started and you will be helping me achieve that goal!

As a contributor to my campaign, not only will you be helping me upgrade my tools and help my business grow, but you'll be able to take home one of my products for yourself depending on what perk you decide to go for!

What I Need and What You Get:

Where does the money go?

  • Wood Supply (Exotic and Natural Woods)
  • New Lathe
  • Upgraded Tools
  • Sandpaper (SO MUCH SANDPAPER)
  • Wood Turning Tools
  • Dust Collector (For my health)
  • Quality of Life Improvements

What are you going to get in return?

  • $15 gets you an incense cone holder (Pear Wood)
  • $25 gets you a 4.5" bowl perfect for holding jewelry and other items (Mixed Wood)
  • $30 gets you 2 Tealight Holders (Pear Wood)
  • $40 gets you 2 Wood Turned Sippy Cups (Pear Wood)
  • $45 gets you 3 Wooden Shot Glasses (Mixed Wood)
  • $60 gets you 4 Custom Coasters (Pick your own design or let me decide what to be burned in!) (Mixed Wood)
  • $80 gets you a Tiki Statue 8" Tall (Custom Designed by me) (Mixed Wood)
  • $100 gets you a wood burned map of Middle Earth, or any fairytale map of your choice. (Bass Wood)
  • $125 gets you a customized sign (2 Feet Long 9" Tall Approximately) with customized text/art (Wood Burned, and Engraved). A great gift for a loved one or something that represents you that can be hanged up in your room or somewhere in the house.  (Premium Pine or Premium Red Oak)

The Impact You'll Make on My Life

Every product I design is hand made. I do not mass produce anything so you will know that time and dedication will be going into each piece of work. My product is something that will last for years to come.

I have already made dozens of products for people and so far, everyone has loved my work. I'm confident that my product will make you happy in the end!

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk I'm taking here is potentially getting a very large business order that may look overwhelming at first since I normally have only one or two projects moving at one time. Luckily I'm detail oriented and will provide a very accurate time frame to deliver my products to you.

Other Ways You Can Help

I realize that right now during these challenging and difficult times, it might be hard to contribute financially to my campaign. Do not fret! There are ways to help out without pledging money to me. You can help by sharing this campaign to friends and family and getting the word out for me. I greatly appreciate anyone that will help me with this campaign!

story:
We perceive the world in terms of solid, tangible objects, but as the physicist Carlo Rovelli eloquently writes, “even the things that are most “thinglike” are nothing more than long events.”

In collaboration with Joseph White

YOUR SUPPORT

I'm fundraising to sponsor my video / sculpture Everyone Has an Interior Landscape, Except Me to be installed in the Spatial Relations Show at the Brooklyn Waterfront Artists Coalition (BWAC)! The piece is opening on September 21  and runs through October 21, 2019.

No matter how small, any donation is greatly appreciated!

WHAT I’M GOING TO DO WITH THE MONEY

  • With your generous contributions, these funds will help me cover the costs of the projectors, media players, support structures, paper, the installation as well as pay my collaborators who will help transport and install the piece and lend technical assistance.

 

A Bit About Me

For those who don’t know me, I'm a dancer (Juilliard, Bill T. Jones and Arnie Zane, the Jose Limon Company) who went on to choreograph (The Downtown Whitey, MOMA PS/1, The Kitchen, The Cunningham Studio, Dance Theater Workshop).

When my pieces began to incorporate film and photography, I went on to work as a photographer’s assistant (Horst P. Horst, Sheila Metzner) before doing my own photography (Takashimaya, Forbes, Martha Stewart, Cartier).

I also have a masters in communication disorders with an interest in linguistics and cognitive therapy.

You can see some of my work and a more comprehensive CV at SalingerPhotography.com

 

MORE DETAILS about the piece

  • Large sheets of glassine paper, suspended in the space, are loosely attached to guide wires. These sheets form what appear to be two 3-dimensional objects, floating in space. Over time, the sheets eventually detach, falling to the ground, forming a crumpled landscape, and disrupting the perception of solidity and permanence. Videos are projected onto the suspended objects and the projection is disrupted as the objects fall apart.
  • A small motion detection camera will document the event.

THE VIDEOS

The videos were shot in the Great Basin, Utah and Istanbul, Turkey in 2018 and were influenced by Virginia Woolf’s writings about wandering: going out into the world, without a plan, getting lost, gaining a sense of freedom, and seeing what is found- an internal and external landscape. 

When I put the video stills up on a wall, and observed them as a collection, I was struck by an underlying, recurrent way I looked at the world around me. It was distinctly a body feminine (tunnels, water, undulating jellies). Even though these videos/ still images were a product of pure happenstance: randomly turning off onto a dirt road in the middle of the desert, the timing of jellyfish collectively mating coinciding with my walking down a dock just outside of Istanbul: what I consistently chose to record had a pattern. When I picked up a camera to document a moment or event, it was the body feminine. My external representation of an internal dialogue. The more I went out into the world, the more I turned the world into me.

story:
Overview

Transforming Totems stand to make multiple marvelous movements with twists and twinkles. Transforming Totems’ aim is to create community culture. Stand between them for immediacy, immersion and illumination. The vibrant 11' tall each, triple towers radiate inclusion. They pose as symbols of understated awe, unity of all, and more understanding on the impact of interactive movement art. The Gardens of Xanadu artists are collectively creating these pieces and the art may be seen at Burning Man 2020, as well as permanently placed in beautiful Boise, Idaho.

These pieces are so very important to us because they are community created, allowing anyone who wants to participate, to be a part of them. The pieces are truly dynamic and communal since the creation of them will also allow for changes and additions that individuals might think up and incorporate. As these 3 totem pillars are to be built first, as part of a whole larger project, Marveling Marvin the Vortexagon, they will invite people who see them to join in on the creation of the entire project, taking part in learning aspects of building, fundraising, project management, lighting, and interactivity.

The art is a daytime and nighttime display. The 3 Transforming Totems and Marveling Marvin are to be made of weather proofed & epoxy coated wood squares in repeated and intriguing twists of patterns like vortexes with thousands of LED lights. 

The included LED lighting, over time, permits people all over the WORLD to code shows on them and play with the lights.  

Lighting can be made to be sound reactive, as well as reactive to external components, that can be added (fun little gadgets that do things with the lights).  

 

What We Need & What You Get

Gardens of Xanadu Artists desire your help in raising at least $9K to make the initial TOTEMS project and then another $35K for complete rebuilding of the rest of MARVELING MARVIN 2.0 project. The original MARVIN was built for and burned as an effigy at Burning Man in 2013, but we're ready to bring it back to stay!

Your contributions go towards the costs of lumber, hardware, anchor and bracing additions, weatherproofing membrane undercoat, plus lighting, computing, networking and programming.

****Your contributions help people see what ART can truly be ... illuminated, sound reactive, community FUN for all ages & backgrounds!****  

 

The Impact

It is possible to make the thousands of LED Lights reactive to a sound stage and we desire to allow anyone around the world, with a subscription pass, to be able to code and synchronize the lights to music. The projects will be displayed in various places for great impact and then at the Gardens of Xanadu in Boise, Idaho.

The pieces will be accompanied by information about how to get involved in creating them further and becoming part of the community that finishes the overall structures.  Art and other forms of creativity often combat depression, isolation, and provides a way to process through tough issues. These pieces offer community efforts to a diverse group, opening up inclusion and providing healthy outlet and during development/presentation, provide a welcoming environment and people. 

Be Helpful, See Immersive Illumination & Do Great Deeds ~ Be, See, and Do with Xanadu!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Get the word out to your friends and family to make some noise about our ART! 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Congratulations [TEST PILOT] you have passed your flight assessment. You are now cleared to pilot your own NASANGELION unit. 

Please choose from the selection of NASANGELION FLIGHT PINS below.  A combination of vintage space exploration flight badges and 90's anime aesthetic, these pins will grant you access to the upper echelons of instrumentality (and they look cool, too!). 

Our NASANGELION PINS are made of high quality metals, colorful enamels and screen-printed elements. They come with locking pin backs, backing card, Collector's Card and FREE stickers!

+ + + + + 

SELECTION

+ + + + +

DETAILS

Due to the success of the campaign, we have started adding new NASANGELION UNIT PINS as ADD-ON item for ALL TIERS. You can choose to get these UNLOCKED pins during CHECK OUT when you order any pins from any tier. 

CURRENT BACKERS: If you'd like these add-on pins, please refer to the "UPDATES" section to see how you can add it to your order! Thank you! 

+ + + + +

TIERS

+ + + + + 

FREEBIES

Every NASANGELION PIN order placed on our campaign comes with these FREE items!

+ + + + +

STRETCH GOALS

 

 

Stickers will be issued PER PIN ORDERED. Example: If you order the Unit-01 pin, you will receive the Unit-01 sticker! If you ordered Unit-00, Production Series unit & Unit-08 you will receive Unit-00, Production Series & Unit-08 stickers! Etc, etc. (Dependent on reaching our $1,200 milestone)

Repeat: Should our campaign reach monetary milestones, ALL orders through this campaign will automatically receive these bonus items!

Follow us on Instagram & Twitter! Feel free to tag a friend / anime fan in any of our #NASANGELION posts! 

+ + + + +

RISKS & CHALLENGES

We at Coastalvania have produced and shipped thousands of pins worldwide! These new NASANGELION designs are ready for production. Two of the designs (Unit-01 & Unit-02) have been produced previously (and sold out), the rest are brand new. This new pressing is to produce ALL the NASANGELION pins. Everything is ready for production! We are hoping to produce the pins in Jan / Feb, and ship them out in March! There is very little risk. All we need is funding!

+ + + + +

ABOUT US

COASTALVANIA is a pin design company & storefront serving the community since 2017. Since then we have shipped over 1,000 orders to satisfied customers worldwide. Our merchandise is of top quality and always includes special goodies & distinctive packaging! We take great pride in our merch, and are dedicated to delivering maximum bang for your buck. You can order with confidence of satisfaction with Coastalvania! 

Thank you for viewing our campaign. Now get in the robot! 

#NASANGELION

story:
Ed.Arts

We have a matching program going through December 24th at 11:59 pm! If we can get 100 donations of $5 or more, an anonymous donor will donate $500 to Ed.Arts! We currently need 86 more donations before the end of day on December 24th. Please help us with a minimum donation today!

Ed.Arts is a registered 501 (c) (3) non-profit organization. Our services are free.
Our mission is to free artist from student debt by educating them before they get into it, and by freeing them from it financially once they’ve proven themselves committed.  

We want to:

  1. Show aspiring artists a realistic picture of their future financial obligations involving student loan debt, and give them access to a database containing information on the realities of student loan debt and alternatives to funding an arts education.  
  2. Provide free information, seminars, webinars and access to financial experts for artists currently dealing with student loan debt obligations while pursuing a career in the arts.
  3. For select artists who have continued to pursue their craft for at least 7 years since leaving school, despite financial hardship, we will make contributions directly to their student debt. The application and vetting process weighs an applicant's financial history with their creative output. Those who are making a bigger impact under harder circumstances get our help first. We strive to one day be able to pay, in full, the remaining balance of the student debt weighing down these select exceptional indebted creatives.  

Where Your Donations Go:

  • Marketing our free services so that the people who need our help can find us
  • Building our network of professionals willing to donate their time to help counsel and mentor “indebted creatives”  to manage their debt.
  • Researching and vetting the ever changing and growing landscape of alternatives to student loans for funding an arts education and amassing them as a comprehensive resource for aspiring artists, their parents and teacher /advisors . SO MUCH RESEARCH!
  • Vetting applications from worthy artists for our Debt Relief Awards, and making as many as we can, for as much as we can, as soon as we can, as we continue to raise donations.
  • Keeping our lights on. (Insurance, operating costs, filing fees, office tools, etc.)
  • Staff to help with development, grant writing, and managing our programs.

Our fundraising never stops. Our free programs must continue to be funded after this Indiegogo campaign ends. You can unite with us in our goals by becoming a recurring member donor at our website. www.educatedartists.org/donate

The Impact We Can Make

  • We know student debt is a national issue. We focus on artists, because while many collegiate majors can pay off their student debt with the wages earned from a career in their area of study - art rarely works that way. After graduating, most artists are often deterred from pursuing their chosen career path because of the debt they incurred training for it. 
  • We believe the successful pursuit of our mission is going to improve the lives of artists, insure the ongoing development of new works created from our nation's artists in all genres, and thereby contribute to a better, more informed, more curious and compassionate society, here and abroad.
  • With Ed.Arts, you are not just funding future arts projects, you are saving artists.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Join our mailing list at www.educatedartists.org/sign-up.
  • Become a recurring donor on our website! www.educatedartists.org/donate.
  • Don't JUST share us with friends who can donate, tell all of your friends who will be able to benefit from our services!
  • Share your student loan stories with us! www.educatedartists.org/contact

story:
Team

The ArtSlooth team is a small and passionate group. We are a non-profit 501(c)(3) that's focused on working with local artists, galleries, small business owners and curators.



 Mission

Our mission is to widen access to local artists by bringing interested parties closer together through our mobile application and live events, We offer an engaging bidding and event experience that motivates both artists and buyers. We do not take a commission on sales which significantly helps reduce pricing barriers.

The Impact

Living in the Bay Area during the "tech boom", we've noticed that emerging artists are increasingly finding it harder to support themselves and engage the public. They too are moving out of San Francisco which we believe has a negative effect on the surrounding culture. There's data suggesting that this is happening in other major metro areas across the nation. We discovered that 66% of Millennials rely on digital platforms to find events and engage with the arts. ArtSlooth can help. We believe it's our duty to engage the public and provide more compelling and intelligent ways to exhibit and support artists. 

KQED and the SF Chronicle have written specifically about this topic. See below.
Priced Out: San Francisco’s Changing Values and Artist Exodus



Testimonial

“I sold a record number of pieces, and more than 65% sold were above my reserve price. The exposure and event turnout were beyond my expectations.“

-- Jared Leake, Artist

(ArtSlooth event 1.22.2016 @ HeartZilla in San Francisco)

What We Need

We are seeking initial funding of $5000. These initial funds will go to the following:
  •  Improving and updating our mobile application and artist web console
  •  The hosting and marketing of future ArtSlooth shows and events
  •  Community and Artist outreach

Featured Perk

In honor of our first ever Indiegogo campaign, ArtSlooth artist and Director of Artist Outreach & Events McKenzie Coonce, has created a limited edition print ! Help us reach our goal by selecting this perk and donating $50 today. This print will be shipped and mailed to you free of charge.

----------------------------
Lino Block -  Monochromatic

10" x 12"


Original Art Perk

ArtSlooth member and up-and-coming Oakland artist, Seren Moran, has graciously donated a painting from her 2015 Feisty series. For a donation of $350 or more, Ineluctable will be shipped to you free of charge. This is a completely one-of-a-kind mixed media painting of dynamic purples, pinks and teals. The criss-crossing lines and layered shapes reflect the chaos and confusion typically experienced during adolescence; a theme throughout this series that's explored with collaged painted paper cuts and the use of vibrant colors.  To learn more about Seren and her work visit www.serenmoran.com

----------------------------
Ineluctable

10" x 10"


Thank You Perk

Select this perk and donate $25 to receive a personalized Thank You card featuring printed artwork from ArtSlooth artist McKenzie Coonce.


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute, but there certainly are things you can do to help spread the word.

  • Contact any artists, local gallery, or event venue you know and spread the word about ArtSlooth. We always like to hear from people who are willing to try something new.
  • Pass along this campaign to anyone you think would like to help support our goals and mission.

story:
Who We Are

Watanili is a grassroots initiative, founded in May 2014, and dedicated for social and political change in Syria. Initially, the idea was to shed light on the civilian aspect of the Syrian uprising; stories and issues that were not being covered enough by the mainstream media in hopes of offering a different image of the lives of ordinary Syrians, their day-to day struggle to live in dignity and peace amidst continuous violence and destruction.

Today, Watanili focuses on supporting displaced Syrians through the means of art,culture and education. We use art and creative educational means to support externally and internally displaced Syrians alongside campaigns and films to continue working towards a new culture based on democracy, rule of law, freedom and social justice.

Our most recent achievement is a little mobile cinema in Aleppo, Syria providing the kids with a safe space of solace to learn and grow culturally in a war-zone. The project serves also as a form of social support, countering psychological trauma and installing some positivity: a sense of play/and normalcy amidst all the despair.Here is a glimpse of our first session:

According to the UNHCR, over 3 million have fled to Syria's immediate neighbours Turkey, Lebanon, Jordan and Iraq. 6.5 million are internally displaced within Syria. Thousands are scattered in Southern Turkey, many of them are children who have  been subjected to violence first-hand: the innocence of childhood has been wiped out by the grim reality that they face. With your help, we can help heal the distress and immerse the kids in learning experiences, exposing them to creative workshops and new ideas.

What We Do & What We Did

**Civil Society, Humanitarian and Social Development** 

  • Local Initiatives, supporting externally and internally displaced Syrians
  • Arts & Creatives, ranging from art-workshops to other creative documentation
  • Films & Events, raising awareness and shedding light on relevant issues on the ground
  • Campaigns, advocating for freedom of expression and dignity
  • Educational initiatives supporting internally and externally displaced Syrians
  To take a look at our work, please visit our website: www.watanili.com 
  And Timeline

Shooting 'Basil' by Adnan Jetto, at Reyanli, Turkey

Arts & Creatives 

  • 'Dreams in a box'; exploring and stimulating the notion of dreams
  • Photography; providing the kids with means to capture their surroundings, their ways of self-expression: an attempt to understand their psychological state
  •  'Guernica of Syria': a collaborative work of art; building messages of hope and dreams in the form of Guernica
  • Design-thinking : A hands-on workshop; learning to design from inception to completion - 2 dimensional to 3 dimensional construction
  • 'Cinema on the go': A replication of our Cinema project in Northern Syria where we will be showing films about community work and basic civic engagement 
  • Calligraphy: A hands-on workshop to practice Arabic calligraphy through a custom curriculum 

Why these Workshops

*** Sustainability *** 

When we first visited the refugees in Reyhanli, Turkey this past September, our main mission was to film a documentary to shed light on their stories, how and when they fled their hometowns, what happened to them and how they are spending their days now in Turkey. But after running these workshops with them we realized that it could not be a one-time event and that it has to continue for these kids to learn and grow, and to be able to impact them positively we needed to come back and continue working with them. 

*** Creativity,Confidence,Imagination *** 

We  realized that most of the children were keen on learning, curious to explore new things, and there was so much hidden potential waiting to thrive. Fares, from Hama, told us that it's been more than two years since he's held a pen or a paper. Diab, from Idleb, said that he quit school as he needed to work to provide for his family.Diab is eleven years old.These kids, despite all odds were thirsting to partake in our creative workshops and produced beautiful art pieces and compelling stories. They were playful and full of life.  We want to provide for them the tools and resources that will continue fostering their imagination and inspire them to create and learn.

*** Well-Being ***

One thing was clear and that was the kids'  happy state of mind. Though for a little while, the kids were happy to carry out these activities whether it was painting, playing music, puzzles, tug of war, reading poetry or even telling us their stories. At one point, we put Ahmed on the spot and asked him what he was feeling in that moment. He replied I am imagining my wedding in this hall. That is how happy he was to be in that place. And we want to create that effect again; that is why we decided to launch this campaign.


Please pledge and consider contributing. Your contributions will go straight to making these projects happen.Every dollar counts in taking us a step closer. And in return, we want to thank you with one of our fantastic perks listed on the right!

-COSTS AND EXPENSES ARE SENT TO DONORS FOR TRANSPARENCY-

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially but still want to support Watanili Arts & Creatives Campaign. You can help us by:

  • Spreading the word among your friends and families and see if they want to contribute; tell them every bit makes a difference! =)
  •  Sharing and spreading the campaign on social media
  • Writing to us at syria@watanili.com if you feel like getting involved in any way
  • Organizing screenings and/or fundraising events in your hometown

story:
New Zvezda Cinema

The building of Zvezda Cinema is in need of repairs to resume its essential function and develop into an authentic cultural center.

The building of Zvezda Cinema, one of the oldest European cinemas, has been abandoned and destroyed. On the 21st of November 2014, a group of filmmakers and cultural workers entered this legendary cinema and began screening films for free for the citizens of Belgrade.

The building is in need of completely new electrical installations and new water supply pipes. The roof needs repairing and the heating system needs to be enabled. This is essential in order to resume the original function of Zvezda Cinema. We are looking forward to open a new chapter in the artistic expression of young Serbia. We would like to expand the potential of cinemas as a mediator between creation and audience, by developing them into authentic cultural centers that provide essential cultural information and a profound experience for the ever-inspired individuals.

History

Zvezda Cinema is a historical monument and by that is under the protection of The Council of Conservation of Monuments. It was the atelier of the early Serbian photographer Milan Jovanovic. The building was erected in 1890 and in 1911 it became the "Koloseum Cinema". Upon the end of World War II in 1945, and the arrival of socialism, it became a state-owned cinema and its name was changed to “Zvezda” (Star).

Recent History

Up until 2004, Belgrade had 19 active cinemas with an annual visit of 4.200.00 people. The company "Beograd Film" and its network of 14 cinemas in the city had a 78% of the overall visits. In 2007 "Beograd Film" was privatized under suspicious circumstances for the mere sum of 9.2 million EUR. Previous to that, its market value was estimated to 60 million EUR. Despite being bound by law to maintain the cinema's main activity for the next two years, the new owner sold five of the cinema venues to a supermarket chain for 19.7 million EUR the next year.

By doing this, the government, the privatization agency and the new owner had damaged the cultural infrastructure of Serbia. Irreparable damage has been done to Serbian filmmaking through the process of privatization of “Beograd Film”. This also carries harmful consequences for the economy and culture of the city and the country. For the first time ever in its 80-year-long tradition, the survival of Serbian cinema was endangered. Without culture, the identity of a country ceases to exist.

On the 21st of November, a group of students, film and cultural workers, occupied the Zvezda Cinema. The occupation has been active for a month and a half so far. The event has been reported by the majority of local media, as well as world media, and has been embraced by the public opinion.

Who are we?

We are a group of citizens - professional and amateur filmmakers, actresses and actors, photographers, producers, architects, film critics, designers, art directors, curators, veterinarians, moviegoers. Some already established, others still students. Mostly in our twenties, but not exclusively - certainly all young at heart and enthusiastic, and that's what counts. We are a mixture of people of different ages, interests and professions, all united as film lovers and cultural activists. We call to all those who don't want to live in a city without cinemas to join us.

What will the money be spent on?

The funding collected from the campaign will be invested in the essential construction work that needs to be done so that the New Zvezda Cinema can function without major obstacles. Several rooftop elements still need to be replaced in order to stop all water leaks. The heating and air vent systems need to be cleaned and revitalized. New electrical installations are required, among with major plumbing work regarding the water-supply system. Those are our priorities.

If we are able to collect funds that enable us to successfully do all the reparations the building needs, we will invest the remaining money in fixing doors and windows, and/or buying new equipment for the cinema.

Hope and Aim

The vital act of the occupation of Zvezda Cinema has started a humble revolution of independent cinema in Serbia. The lack of cinemas that aren't purely profit driven caused a lack of diversity in Belgrade's cultural and film environment. The audience was seriously deprived by this absence of meaningful content. They may not be aware of what caused this, but they are starving for fresh, new and different cinematic and cultural perspectives.

As the saying goes - "Where there's a will, there's a way". We are looking forward to create a cultural center inside of the Zvezda Cinema, a center for the already ripe intellectuals and the upcoming youth that have so much to give. We do not want to blame anyone or anything, or stay forever without taking matters into our own hands and doing the best we can. We want to shine a light on the current situation. November 21st marks the beginning of a very bright future and the New Zvezda Cinema has a shimmery, wonderful artistic one!

We hope to bring the building to its full function and more. Slowly but steadily, we want to create a base that will support the bright future of the art of cinema in Serbia and this part of Europe.

Please, support this project. 
You can be a part of a positive approach to culture.

Risks and challenges

Zvezda Cinema will be renovated without the guarantee of it working as a cinema, as there's a parallel legal battle going on - however, it will most likely last for years. The desired outcome is for Zvezda to become a publicly owned center. We want to save cinema and this particular cinema from ruin.

New electrical installations are required, among with major plumbing work regarding the water-supply system. Those are our priorities.If we are able to collect funds that enable us to successfully do all the reparations the building needs, we will invest the remaining money in fixing doors and windows, and/or buying new equipment for the cinema.Hope and AimThe vital act of the occupation of Zvezda Cinema has started a humble revolution of independent cinema in Serbia. The lack of cinemas that aren't purely profit driven caused a lack of diversity in Belgrade's cultural and film environment. The audience was seriously deprived by this absence of meaningful content. They may not be aware of what caused this, but they are starving for fresh, new and different cinematic and cultural perspectives.As the saying goes - "Where there's a will, there's a way". We are looking forward to create a cultural center inside of the Zvezda Cinema, a center for the already ripe intellectuals and the upcoming youth that have so much to give. We do not want to blame anyone or anything, or stay forever without taking matters into our own hands and doing the best we can. We want to shine a light on the current situation. November 21st marks the beginning of a very bright future and the New Zvezda Cinema has a shimmery, wonderful artistic one!We hope to bring the building to its full function and more. Slowly but steadily, we want to create a base that will support the bright future of the art of cinema in Serbia and this part of Europe.Please, support this project. You can be a part of a positive approach to culture.Risks and challengesZvezda Cinema will be renovated without the guarantee of it working as a cinema, as there's a parallel legal battle going on - however, it will most likely last for years. The desired outcome is for Zvezda to become a publicly owned center. We want to save cinema and this particular cinema from ruin.

story:
What is the Hive?

Artists need to be able to live, work, and exhibit without putting themselves in debt. The Hive will give them all of this.

The Hive will be a collective of apartments containing private studios, as well as large communal studios, and a dedicated exhibition space that will be open to the public for special events. All of this will be included in the artist's affordable rent. If they choose to register a business license, they will also be able to deduct a portion of the rent and utilities from their taxes. 

This could be the opportunity that turns a struggle into a career for an emerging artist.

The location couldn't be better. Artist Enclave Historic Kenwood is less than 1 mile from Downtown St. Pete, the Warehouse Arts District, and  just a few blocks from the shops of the Grand Central District, including two art supply shops and two cafés that display local art.


What's in it for you?

Yep, $50,000 dollars is a lot of money. But every cent of it will go into acquiring a property for the Hive to inhabit. Significant donations will be rewarded with the gift of ART!  See samples from the artist's portfolio at perrydevick.com

$500 = Commissioned Pet Portrait by Perry Devick, 18"x24", oil on canvas

$1000 = Commissioned Bust Portrait by Perry Devick, 24"x36", oil on canvas

$1500 = Life size Full Figure Portrait by Perry Devick, oil on canvas

Over $1500 = Large & detailed commission to be agreed upon between artist and contributor.


This project can only happen if I can raise a down payment for the initial property. The perfect property is available now, but if I wait, it could slip away.



More information...

I previously owned a gallery in a similarly zoned artist enclave, Village of the Arts in Bradenton, Florida. This gallery, an LLC doing business as Studio 1411, aimed to provide exhibition opportunities for local art students and emerging artists. The business was successful for over a year until the departure of one of the founders caused the LLC to dissolve. I have a Bachelor of Fine Arts in Illustration from Ringling College of Art and Design and a Master of Arts in Teaching from Savannah College of Art and Design. Teaching and supporting the growth of artists are passions that have been guiding my life for many years. I currently teach Elementary Art for Pinellas County Schools, but it is not the environment where I would like to focus my energy in the future. This business would allow me to support fellow artists and my own fine art career on a deeper level.

I also have experience with rehabbing and repurposing residential spaces. For Studio 1411, we turned two dreary residential spaces into fully functional, beautiful galleries. I have also done this several times alongside my father, who has dealt in property rental for years. I am fully aware of the amount and type of work involved in this type of endeavor. While I am experienced in many remodel processes, I am also wise enough to know when to hire a licensed contractor.

Historic Kenwood is a neighborhood that is home to many artists and often includes art shows in its annual events. This year for the celebrated Bungalow Fest, they dedicated an entire home on the home tour as a gallery. Now, after much hard work on behalf of the Neighborhood Association, it has just received a zoning overlay designation as an Artist Enclave and is poised to become a cultural center for St. Petersburg. This designation allows artists to run a legal business out of their home, which provides tax benefits. Anticipation of this designation was one of the reasons I purchased my homestead in this area and now that it is a reality, I intend to be fully involved in the growth of this community. 

Elsewhere, an artist is not legally allowed to have a home studio, but renting a studio separate of a home adds up to a sum many artists cannot afford. Not only will combining the two make an artist’s home business legitimate in the eyes of the government, it also makes it affordable. Even better than the reduced cost of rent, the zoning overlay allows artists to deduct a portion of their living expenses from their taxes. This was very beneficial to the operation of Studio 1411 and will be for The Hive and its residents as well. This enclave creates a niche that is not available anywhere else in our city. The service I plan to provide to local artists will be entirely unique. 

I see many opportunities for expansion within this business model.

·  Larger or separate galleries, possibly closer to or on Central Ave.

·  More buildings added to the rental complex or a new complex in a different area.

·  An art school.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate money, there are other ways you can help make The Hive happen :
  • consider donating an artwork that could be an incentive for contributors!
  • SHARE, SHARE, SHARE! Tell everyone you know. Tell strangers, even. :)

story:
Hello, my name is Kevin Von Holtermann and I have been an artist for the past 15 years.

After years of lugging my art to gallery after gallery and having them either tell me I didn't have enough showing experience or education to hang my work in their gallery, or telling me yes but we will take 50-75% of your sales... I decided to DO IT MYSELF .

I worked in a salon and I had an awesome boss who coaxed me to open my first Kev Von Holt gallery in Philadelphia pa. I was a hairstylist and artist at that point but sooner than later the painting would overshadow my desire for a hair career, and those blank walls of the salon gallery were the reason why...

SOMEONE GAVE ME WALL SPACE AND LET ME KEEP 100% of sales.

I was so inspired by this concept of someone opening up their business for me to hang my work on their walls , that I soon started to create boat loads of amazing works .

It gave me an open door to a usually closed door art world.


Fast forward to now... I have since sold enough art from that generous first gesture of free wall space to now have my own art gallery in the beautiful budding town of Flemington NJ (my hometown)

I now have built a loyal following of collectors and friends and want to pay it forward to my fellow artists ... 

That is where you come in ...

I need to be able to keep the rent going after this first year, I prepaid the first year ... But am looking to you to help me keep it going for the next year , so I can focus on building a network and spreading the selfless mission of art.

I will host artists and let them keep 100% of profits from sales, I will make nothing .

The space (Kev Von Holt Gallery) will give artists the walls, and the name and experience that will guide them forward with confidence and also a little pocket cash to continue to realize their dreams.

Thank you for your time .

Much Love

KVH
