story:
"A Dream Too Long Deferred!"

Luis Colmenares is perhaps the most talented and versatile artist you may have never heard of.  Before Katrina in 2005, he employed over 25 artists in his New Orleans studio designing and building restaurant interiors.   Today, his designs and craftsmanship can be seen in many upscale Crescent City venues such as Emeril's, Nola's, K. Paul's, Red Fish and others.  Quite a bit of Luis's art appears in movies starring Sylvester Stallone, Seth Rogan and others.  Then, in the blink of an eye New Orleans was flooded after Hurricane Katrina .  When the water receded, Luis metal art studio was destroyed, his equipment missing and his artists scattered.  Then a mere 5-years later a BP Oil platform exploded and burned in the Gulf of Mexico.  With these back to back catastrophes, the economy of southern Louisiana was destroyed causing the demand for art to dry up overnight.  

                       Luis' TV Documentary with George Mason University

Over ten years have now passed and there are still thousands of businesses throughout the region who are still left un-whole.  Though they may have survived, the unbearable wounds inflicted upon them by the flood has prevented them from coming anywhere close to their former selves. 

Every year Luis Colmenares contributes many thousands of dollars worth of art to causes such as the annual WHITNEY ZOO-TO-DO fundraiser for Audubon Zoo . This year will be 29th year that Luis has donated as many as 50 pieces per annual event.

The goal of this Indiegogo campaign is to help undo the damage inflicted upon Luis Colmenares by returning him to his own "metal art studio". 

You can help by selecting one or more gifts in exchange for your contribution.   Even more importantly, help spread the word about this funding campaign to encourage others to come and contribute as well.  


After so many years of contributing art to worthy causes, it's time  to give back to Luis.  Help make this campaign the great success it can be.  Contribute to this campaign and together we can return Luis to his very own Metal Art Studio.

Allen Y. Kimble, Jr., 

                                                                  ***********

WHAT IS NEEDED  This campaign is set with the goal of raising two hundred thousand dollars, which is an amount adequate to buy the facility we want to acquire.  Our ultimate wish is to raise twice that amount to enable the purchase of the building and to perform a complete structural upgrade of the facility.  That amount would also allow the complete outfitting of the building with all new equipment and supplies as well.  This is very necessary because, like his Miller 185 welding machines (which was submerged by Katrina flood waters), every piece of equipment was wetted.  They all are far beyond their serviceable lifespans.  

MASTERS ART RETREAT SCHOOL Should this campaign go viral and become wildly successful, we'll use funds to create a resident Art Masters Retreat School. Seasoned artists will spend up to five days learning under the direction of Luis Colmenares. These students will receive hands-on training in all aspect of unconventional art creation in the use of stainless-steel, canvas, foam and other esoteric materials.  They will use the Plasma torch and Welding tips as paint brushs upon various metals as their canvas.  We will establish a scholarship award so that every class will include one student who, otherwise, might not be able to afford to participate. CLICK HERE TO VISIT ART METAL STUDIO

GIFTS FOR YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS We have an amazing collection of unique gifts to choose from in exchange for your contributions.  You simply choose one or more items from Luis' wide selection of art inspired gifts.  For the serious art collector, there is even a couple of original Bleudreaux prototype paintings that are signed and dated.  They will one day become very valuable because, 2016 is going to be remembered as the year that Bleudreaux, the blue Crawfish, made his debut. 

                                                                  .....

LUIS COLMENARES

ABOUT THE ARTIST, LUIS COLMENARES  

If you have ever had an opportunity to chat with Luis, you will quickly discovered that few artists anywhere in the world can match his eclecticism and artistic output.  A good example would be the 2015 Whitney "Zoo-To-do" at Audubon Zoo--for which he designed, fabricated, delivered and set up over 50 unique pieces of Art.  The zoo's four signature art pieces were each 15 feet tall above the water, and three feet below in the elephant pool. 

BIOGRAPHY  The success of this crowd funding campaign will also enable the research and writing of his biography as a coffee tabletop picture book chronicling the amazing Life and Art of Luis Colmenares. 


                                                               *******

THE BIRTH OF A BLEUDREAUX The typical image of an artist while painting is perhaps the one featuring him or her standing, or sometimes seated before an easel.  Of Luis however, you'll almost always find him seated comfortably on his overstuffed sofa with two large pillows for back support.  Invariably, the television will be tuned in to some abstract program.  Peeking over Luis' shoulder while he is working is an exciting opportunity to witness the birth of some of the most incredible art projects ever.  Here we find him Luis putting the finishing touches on "Mardi Gras 2016", the largest Bleudreaux ever at over six feet tall.                                                                     

MARDI GRAS 2016

BLEUDEAUX'S "Bayou All-Stars" Band

THAT BANDAGED HAND                                                                

In the closing day of completing the Challmette Hurricane Katrina Sculpture, Luis experienced the first of two potentially career-ending accidents.  He walked a bit too closely to the razor sharp edge of a piece of stainless steel and cut tendons in his right hand.  Despite the severity of his wound, he pressed ahead with completing the "Will Power Park" Memorial Sculpture in time for the August 29th dedication.  


Annually, Luis makes trophies for the "New Orleans Track Club's" Thanksgiving Day Marathon.  Here we see him out lining the shape of a roadrunner upon rolled sheet metal to be cut with a plasma torch.  As you can see, after his accident, Luis had little time for healing because everyone knows, "Great Art Waits For No One!". 


SCULPTURE Will Power Park Memorial in Challmette


THAT BANDAGED LEFT ARM  Less than a year after the hand accident, misfortune struck Luis again for the second time.  While stopped at a red light of Claiborne Avenue, Luis' truck was struck from behind by a car traveling at high speed.  The impact thrust him forward, causing his seatbelt to exert great pressure against Luis' left shoulder.  After enduring several months of excruciating pain, he went in for surgery to repair his damaged rotator cup.  After the repair of a 12-inch tear, Luis was left with 26 stiches and his arm in a sling.  Again, despite the severity of his wound, Luis forged ahead with completing his obligation, commissioned by the St. Bernard Parish "CY  PRES Committee".  Compare the photo above to the one below and you will discover that up top, Luis has his right arm in a white sling versus below, where his left arm is in a sling of a different color.
  

Two weeks following Luis' rotator-cup surgery, he was commissioned to create this piece for Kim Bullock as a gift for celebrity businessman Paul Michell.  Despite excruciating pain from the operation, Luis delivered the Bleudreaux on time.  If you look closely, you might see a hint of a smile that I coaxed out of Luis for this photo. 

PAUL MITCHELL

Luis first commission immediately after his rotatorcup sugery, was to create a piece of art for Kim, a former intern of Luis and family friend.  The art piece was to be a gift for a celebrity businessman, Paul Mitchell, whose prominence arises from the womens beauty industry.  Though the piece lived up to Luis' high standards, it was very obvious that throughout the design and creation of it, he was experiencing a great deal of physical pain and discomfort.  Nonetheless, we were told that Paul Mitchell was ecstatic about his Bleudreaux. 
WHITNEY BANK "ZOO-TO-DO", AUDUBON NATURE FUNDRAISER  


2015 "ZOO-TO-DO" SKETCH AND DESIGN LAYOUT 

                                                                        *****                                                                

SCULPTURE "Paso Fino" 

The commission to sculp PASO FINO was one of the most amusing observations I've had of my client, Luis Colmenares.  A well known Chalmette attorney has a passionate love for the Paso Fino breed and wanted a sculpture created.  I happened to have over-heard the attorney's inquiries about Luis's ability to take on the task.  He asked Luis, "have you ever sculpted a horse before?".  Luis's answered "No! But I bought a book on horses, and I've visited a friends farm to see his horses!  It was all that I could do to keep from laughing as he reminded me of a popular television commercial.  In the end, the sculpting of Paso Fino was a true work of art which enabled Luis to stand out among his peers. 



SCULPTURE Christian Brothers School Falcon
The only time I was ever indoubt about Luis's ability to deliver a project on time was in the sculpting of this mascot for "Christian Brothers School".  Each and every feather had to be cut with a plasma torch, shaped, bent, chisled, welded and buffed. Then, on the night before it was to be delivered, the commissioner of the falcon said that she wanted to cancel the project.  Its beek did not look anything like she was anticipating.  Luis reassured the client that he'd rework the beek.  Undetered, Luis removed, reworked and completed a new beek for the falcon by 8:AM the next morning .  Even as the bird was being loaded into the van for transporting, he was still sculpting, bending and tweeking to get it perfect.  This project more than any other taught me that Luis Colmenares produces at his very best when he is under the extreme stress of an approaching deadline.   



SCULPTURE OF FOAM

A client commissioned a wearable costume inspired by the late artist Georgia O'Keeffe. There is no denying that Georgia’s flower paintings helped to perpetuated the belief about women artists as flower painters.  Though it is easy to view a suggestions of the female sex organ among her paintings, Georgia vehemently denied an association of the female anatomy with her beautiful flowers paintings.  None the less, Georgia exploited long-standing gender associations with flowers and helped to recast the genre. In the process, Georgia O'Keeffe enabled herself to be seen as an uninhibited “modern” woman and vanguard artist.   Luis Colmenares's Foam art was worn at a recent ball in New Orleans and was said to have been the center of attention.


                                                                  *****
                                                                            
  
INTUIT'S 2015 TURBO-TAX television commercial featured the art work of Luis Colmenares.  "Carl Mack Presents" commissioned Luis to furnish two colonial era costumes for an Intuit Turbo-Tax TV commercial. The backdrop for the shoot setting was a typical Mardi Gras scene. The filming was completed in time for the broadcasting in the latter part of January 2015.  To view Intuit's commercial, visit this link:  CLICK HERE TO VIEW COMMERCIAL!   
                                                                    
                                           *****  FAMILY MATTERS *****
                                                                

                  Emma's miracle! Four or five days following the accident.                                                                    
A little less than two months ago, Emma, Luis' younger of two daughters was injured in an accident.  Though it could had been far more serious, she was blessed and she is recovering very well.  However, Emma has some very high hurdles to climb on the road to complete recovery.  Luis and the Colmenares family would like to thank you for your prayers, well wishes and support.   
                                                     *****  OUR OBJECTIVE  *****

 

                      A METAL ART FACILITY FOR LUIS COLMENARES  

The goal of this campaign is to buy, rehabilitate and equip an industrial grade building  for Luis Colmenares.  It will serve as his art metal construction facility and art studio. The upgrade of the facility includes residential area to temporarily house students who visit to participate in Luis' Art Retreats and Boot Camps. 
                                                                           *******
                                                             A SPECIAL THANKS 
MIKHALA IVERSEN  We owe so much to "Team Bleudreaux" member Mikhala Iversen.  It is her voice that is heard singing background on his videos.  I especially enjoy listening to Mikhala sing Bleudreaux's theme songs, "Squeeze Me" & "Nature Boy".  To you Mikhala, we owe a debt of gratutude.  Thank you, Allen Kimble     

Mikhala as an infant upon the arm of the late, great LOUIS ARMSTRONG.  Her mother was a profession jazz singer from Minneapolis, and father, a Danish lover of the jazz.  Mikhala's home in her native Copenhagen was a favored stop-over for many of the Jazz greats who were touring Europe.  

Inspired by her up close and personal association with so many jazz greats, Mikhala was destined to come to New Orleans to sing Jazz.  We are very happy to have her Iversen as the voice "Team Bleudreaux".  To hear hear Mikhala Iversen sing 

Bleudreaux's theme song "Squeeze Me", CLICK HERE!

 Thanks Mikhala!


                             Go forth!  Treat yourself to gifts of Style and Jazz!

                                                      The Perfect Combination! 

End





 

  


























 




 

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

You can help by selecting one or more gifts in exchange for your contribution.   Even more importantly, help spread the word about this funding campaign to encourage others to come and contribute as well.  


After so many years of contributing art to worthy causes, it's time  to give back to Luis.  Help make this campaign the great success it can be.  Contribute to this campaign and together we can return Luis to his very own Metal Art Studio.
Allen Y. Kimble, Jr., 
                                                                  ***********






















WHAT IS NEEDED  This campaign is set with the goal of raising two hundred thousand dollars, which is an amount adequate to buy the facility we want to acquire.  Our ultimate wish is to raise twice that amount to enable the purchase of the building and to perform a complete structural
upgrade of the facility.  That amount would also allow the complete outfitting of the building with all new equipment and supplies as well.  This is very necessary because, like his Miller 185 welding machines (which was submerged by Katrina flood waters), every piece of equipment was wetted.  They all are far beyond their serviceable lifespans.  


MASTERS ART RETREAT SCHOOL Should this campaign go viral and become
wildly successful, we'll use funds to create a resident Art Masters Retreat School. Seasoned artists will spend up to five days learning under the direction of Luis Colmenares. These students will receive hands-on training in all aspect of unconventional art creation in the use of stainless-steel, canvas, foam and other esoteric materials.  They will use the Plasma torch and Welding tips as paint brushs upon various metals as their canvas.  We will establish a scholarship award so that every class will include one student who, otherwise, might not be able to afford to participate. CLICK HERE TO VISIT ART METAL STUDIO



GIFTS FOR YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS We have an amazing collection of unique gifts to choose from in exchange for your contributions.  You simply choose one or more items from Luis' wide selection of art inspired gifts.  For the serious art collector, there is even a couple of original Bleudreaux prototype paintings that are signed and dated.  They will one day become very valuable because, 2016 is going to be remembered as the year that Bleudreaux, the blue Crawfish, made his debut. 


                                                                  .....
LUIS COLMENARES


ABOUT THE ARTIST, LUIS COLMENARES  
If
you have ever had an opportunity to chat with Luis, you will quickly discovered that
few artists anywhere in the world can match his eclecticism and artistic output.  A good example would be the 2015 Whitney "Zoo-To-do" at Audubon Zoo--for which he designed, fabricated, delivered
and set up over 50 unique pieces of Art.  The zoo's four
signature art pieces were each 15 feet tall above the water, and three feet below in the elephant pool. 
BIOGRAPHY  The success
of this crowd funding campaign will also enable the research and writing of his biography as a coffee
tabletop picture book chronicling the amazing Life and Art of Luis Colmenares. 

                                                               *******

THE BIRTH OF A BLEUDREAUX The typical image of an artist while painting is perhaps the one featuring him or her standing, or sometimes seated before an easel.  Of Luis however, you'll almost always find him seated comfortably on his overstuffed sofa with two large pillows for back support.  Invariably, the television will be tuned in to some abstract program.  Peeking over Luis' shoulder while he is working is an exciting opportunity to witness the birth of some of the most incredible art projects ever.  Here we find him Luis putting the finishing touches on "Mardi Gras 2016", the largest Bleudreaux ever at over six feet tall.                                                                     


MARDI GRAS 2016

BLEUDEAUX'S "Bayou All-Stars" Band

THAT BANDAGED HAND                                                                In the closing day of completing the Challmette Hurricane Katrina Sculpture, Luis experienced the first of two potentially career-ending accidents.  He walked a bit too closely to the razor sharp edge of a piece of stainless steel and cut tendons in his right hand.  Despite the severity of his wound, he pressed ahead with completing the "Will Power Park" Memorial Sculpture in time for the August 29th dedication.  



Annually, Luis makes trophies for the "New Orleans Track Club's" Thanksgiving Day Marathon.  Here we see him out lining the shape of a roadrunner upon rolled sheet metal to be cut with a plasma torch.  As you can see, after his accident, Luis had little time for healing because everyone knows, "Great Art Waits For No One!". 


SCULPTURE Will Power Park Memorial in Challmette





THAT BANDAGED LEFT ARM  Less than a year after the hand accident, misfortune struck Luis again for the second time.  While stopped at a red light of Claiborne Avenue, Luis' truck was struck from behind by a car traveling at high speed.  The impact thrust him forward, causing his seatbelt to exert great pressure against Luis' left shoulder.  After enduring several months of excruciating pain, he went in for surgery to repair his damaged rotator cup.  After the repair of a 12-inch tear, Luis was left with 26 stiches and his arm in a sling.  Again, despite the severity of his wound, Luis forged ahead with completing his obligation, commissioned by the St. Bernard Parish "CY  PRES Committee".  Compare the photo above to the one below and you will discover that up top, Luis has his right arm in a white sling versus below, where his left arm is in a sling of a different color.
  





Two weeks following Luis' rotator-cup surgery, he was commissioned to create this piece for Kim Bullock as a gift for celebrity businessman Paul Michell.  Despite excruciating pain from the operation, Luis delivered the Bleudreaux on time.  If you look closely, you might see a hint of a smile that I coaxed out of Luis for this photo. 
PAUL MITCHELL




Luis first commission immediately after his rotatorcup sugery, was to create a piece of art for Kim, a former intern of Luis and family friend.  The art piece was to be a gift for a celebrity businessman, Paul Mitchell, whose prominence arises from the womens beauty industry.  Though the piece lived up to Luis' high standards, it was very obvious that throughout the design and creation of it, he was experiencing a great deal of physical pain and discomfort.  Nonetheless, we were told that Paul Mitchell was ecstatic about his Bleudreaux. 



WHITNEY BANK "ZOO-TO-DO", AUDUBON NATURE FUNDRAISER  







2015 "ZOO-TO-DO" SKETCH AND DESIGN LAYOUT 


                                                                        *****                                                                



SCULPTURE "Paso Fino" 
The commission to sculp PASO FINO was one of the most amusing observations I've had of my client, Luis Colmenares.  A well known Chalmette attorney has a passionate love for the Paso Fino breed and wanted a sculpture created.  I happened to have over-heard the attorney's inquiries about Luis's ability to take on the task.  He asked Luis, "have you ever sculpted a horse before?".  Luis's answered "No! But I bought a book on horses, and I've visited a friends farm to see his horses!  It was all that I could do to keep from laughing as he reminded me of a popular television commercial.  In the end, the sculpting of Paso Fino was a true work of art which enabled Luis to stand out among his peers. 






SCULPTURE Christian Brothers School Falcon


The only time I was ever indoubt about Luis's ability to deliver a project on time was in the sculpting of this mascot for "Christian Brothers School".  Each and every feather had to be cut with a plasma torch, shaped, bent, chisled, welded and buffed. Then, on the night before it was to be delivered, the commissioner of the falcon said that she wanted to cancel the project.  Its beek did not look anything like she was anticipating.  Luis reassured the client that he'd rework the beek.  Undetered, Luis removed, reworked and completed a new beek for the falcon by 8:AM the next morning .  Even as the bird was being loaded into the van for transporting, he was still sculpting, bending and tweeking to get it perfect.  This project more than any other taught me that Luis Colmenares produces at his very best when he is under the extreme stress of an approaching deadline.   








SCULPTURE OF FOAM
A client commissioned a wearable costume inspired by the late artist Georgia O'Keeffe. There is no denying that Georgia’s flower paintings helped to perpetuated the belief about women artists as flower painters.  Though it is easy to view a suggestions of the female sex organ among her paintings, Georgia vehemently denied an association of the female anatomy with her beautiful flowers paintings.  None the less, Georgia exploited long-standing gender associations with flowers and helped to recast the genre. In the process, Georgia O'Keeffe enabled herself to be seen as an uninhibited “modern” woman and vanguard artist.   Luis Colmenares's Foam art was worn at a recent ball in New Orleans and was said to have been the center of attention.








                                                                  *****

                                                                              


INTUIT'S 2015 TURBO-TAX television commercial featured the art work of Luis Colmenares.  "Carl Mack Presents" commissioned Luis to furnish two colonial era costumes for an Intuit Turbo-Tax TV commercial. The backdrop for the shoot setting was a typical Mardi Gras scene. The filming was completed in time for the broadcasting in the latter part of January 2015.  To view Intuit's commercial, visit this link:  CLICK HERE TO VIEW COMMERCIAL!   


                                                                    


                                           *****  FAMILY MATTERS *****


                                                                
                  Emma's miracle! Four or five days following the accident.                                                                    A little less than two months ago, Emma, Luis' younger of two daughters was injured in an accident.  Though it could had been far more serious, she was blessed and she is recovering very well.  However, Emma has some very high hurdles to climb on the road to complete recovery.  Luis and the Colmenares family would like to thank you for your prayers, well wishes and support.   


                                                     *****  OUR OBJECTIVE  *****


 


                      A METAL ART FACILITY FOR LUIS COLMENARES  

The goal of this campaign is to buy, rehabilitate and equip an industrial grade building  for Luis Colmenares.  It will serve as his art metal construction facility and art studio. The upgrade of the facility includes residential area to temporarily house students who visit to participate in Luis' Art Retreats and Boot Camps. 

                                                                           *******
                                                             A SPECIAL THANKS 

MIKHALA IVERSEN  We owe so much to "Team Bleudreaux" member Mikhala Iversen.  It is her voice that is heard singing background on his videos.  I especially enjoy listening to Mikhala sing Bleudreaux's theme songs, "Squeeze Me" & "Nature Boy".  To you Mikhala, we owe a debt of gratutude.  Thank you, Allen Kimble     



Mikhala as an infant upon the arm of the late, great LOUIS ARMSTRONG.  Her mother was a profession jazz singer from Minneapolis, and father, a Danish lover of the jazz.  Mikhala's home in her native Copenhagen was a favored stop-over for many of the Jazz greats who were touring Europe.  
Inspired by her up close and personal association with so many jazz greats, Mikhala was destined to come to New Orleans to sing Jazz.  We are very happy to have her Iversen as the voice "Team Bleudreaux".  To hear hear Mikhala Iversen sing Bleudreaux's theme song "Squeeze Me", CLICK HERE!


 Thanks Mikhala!




                             Go forth!  Treat yourself to gifts of Style and Jazz!

                                                      The Perfect Combination! 
End






 
  









































































 







    The Impact Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:  Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world. Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one). Make it real for people and build trust.    Risks & Challenges  People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.  Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles. Describe your plan for solving these challenges.    Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!   And that's all there is to it.

story:
What is the Fruit Belt Project?

The Fruit Belt Mural Project is a Greentopia project working with DUNWOODE Consulting to create a series of large-scale vibrantly colored community driven public artworks, as a strategy to provide socially engaged art to transform a neighborhood that has been overtaken by blight and disinvestment.

The Fruit Belt Mural Project is a beautification movement driven to transform the extreme neglect in the JOSANA neighborhood; in the Northwest quadrant of Rochester through: resident engaged art, creative place making, urban design, and economic stimulus.

The Fruit Belt Mural Project will paint key corridors in the areas store fronts, residencies, businesses, and abandoned properties.

The fruit named streets are the bases for the fruit inspired color palette of the Fruit Belt project, unifying the dilapidated passages and symbolically “banding together urban design and community spirit into a unified neighborhood experience and new identity: The Fruit Belt.

The Fruit Belt project model shows and affective and efficient way to catalyze change, build social capital, and create hope with an artistic product that is more than aesthetic.

Project Goals:

To give the neighborhood a unified identity

To inspire hope and optimism throughout the community

To create jobs for local residents

To bring beauty to historic neighborhood

To generate positive attention for the neighborhood often highlighted for negative reasons

To improve local business viability

To inspire long term investment and additional resources for the community

New paint turns city's Ghost Town into Fruit Belt



Why does the Fruit Belt Mural Project need your help?

Your financial support will allow us to complete the project. In order to finish the work we have begun in the Jay Street area we would like to extend the opportunity to more youth from the neighborhood to join our creative team. We need to cover the cost of their labor, paint for the large-scale murals, as well as tools and building supplies for the fruit based garden. We also need to rent construction lifts to safely paint the murals. The youth will also work to create a website and a volg where they share their experiences in their own words to keep you connected with their day to day progress.

It is also our hope to send the group of young artists to North Philadelphia, PA to experience the Philly Painting Project where artists Haas and Hahn began the first phase of the project that has inspired ours. These artists believed in a similar neighborhood, living and painting side by side with the residents.


What has the Fruit Belt Mural Project been up to?

This past May we organized the city’s largest community paint initiative called The Big Paint Out! to kick off our Mural project during National Painting Week. Over 250 people from all walks of life arrived at the corner of Jay & Grape Street to paint. The kick-off was sponsored by Sherwin-Williams.

Project Director Shawn Dunwoody worked with Louis Petix from College Club Beverage to create a Fruit Belt Seltzer. was created to help the project and education the neighborhood on the importance of less sugar consumption

We have begun landscaping The Fruit Belt Garden. The city of Rochester’s first all fruit based garden including fruit trees.

Four students from school 17 have helped to design traffic boxes surrounding the area connecting the Fruit Belt Project throughout the Northwest corridor of Rochester.

Our crew has been painting 2 buildings Stop One Market: 352 Jay St. and College Club beverage: 63 Grape St. (A third has been added)

Designed a illuminated crosswalk connecting the two large buildings that are being painted.

Our young artists have painted in Rochester’s Wall Therapy and FUA’s B Boy BBQ

Check out our gallery page to see more.


Why not stop by our site when you have a moment to see how what we do is inspiring the community?

 If you are able to give a gift, we are truly grateful. If what you can contribute at this time is time, we will take that too.

The Fruit Belt Project has had a powerfully positive connection with the Rochester community. That is why we asking for your support to strengthen the Fruit Belt Project and community. The financial gifts we receive from our Indiegogo will go directly to the Fruit Belt Project to help us grow our community; to build hope, to inspire and create a thread of love for all of our city.

We are asking for your gift to help us reach our $25,000 goal for the Fruit Belt Project. Please consider spreading the word or donating as generously as possible to a mission driven to beautify our city’s landscape.

_____________________________________________________________________________

THE PERKS

The Fruit Belt team has been working together to offer you fantastic swag, artwork, and community gifts to help us reach our goal. Take a look at our gallery page to see our artists at work... to perk.

Fruit Belt Button

For your $10 seed of support you will receive a one-inch hand pressed Fruit Belt logo button. 200 available





Fruit Belt T-shirt

When you donate $40, you will receive a hand-screened cotton; two color (black and white) Fruit Belt logo T-shirt. Our young artist use water-based inks to hand set each shirt’s design with creativity, focus, and care. No two shirts are alike. 

50 available




Small Spray Can Bouquet

For your donation of $100 or more you will receive a small bouquet of “flowers” crafted by our artists recycling discarded spray paint cans into a beautiful arrangement of color. No two are alike and colors will vary. 20 available




6 Pack of Fruit Belt Seltzer (in a hand crafted wooden case)

For a donation of $200 or more you will be one of the first to experience the locally crafted Lemon-Lime Seltzer that Collage Club Beverage (located in the Fruit Belt neighborhood) generously bottled in support of the project.

The six-pack comes with recipe cards for cocktail ideas crafted by local bartender Donny Clutterbuck and bartender Caitlin Graham of Cure Restaurant.
Our young artists build each case from re-purposed wooden soda crates and shipping pallets.  They hand screen each with our logo and wood-burned their signature into each case they created.

Due to the handmade nature and availability of materials, appearance may vary slightly; no two items will be identical. 20 available




2’ x 2’ Post Notes (small)

For a donation of $500 you receive a hand crafted 3 dimensional Post Note sculpted and painted by our young artists with an inspiring quote of your choice for your home or office. 10 available




Sponsor 4’ x 4’ Post Note for Rochester (large)

For your $1000 gift you can sponsor a public piece of artwork. Our team of youth will paint a quote of your choice on a hand sculpted, larger than life 4’x4’ Post Note and install it in a neighborhood within the City of Rochester. Your (first) name or company logo will be added to the quote as a direct message to the community. (Some limits may apply.) 4 available




Sponsor a Words to Live By Mural

With your gift of $2500 you have the opportunity to be fully engaged with the Rochester community in the mural making process. A personally meaningful quote created by you will be painted as a full wall mural (6’x10’) in the Fruit Belt neighborhood designed by our art team.

Your (first) name or company logo will be added to the quote as a direct message to the community. (Some limits may apply.) 3 available

story:
UPDATE:

Thank you everybody! You can find the newest previews on  the EMCCV website and more so on my SailorXv3 deviantart account!

A prototype has been sent to all contributors on January 7th and 8th! Development is ongoing and very exciting! :)

Short Summary

Ever had an idea for a character? You love dress-up games or you're some kind of story-teller, writer, gamer, fan. Now you want to share your idea with your friends, publisher, illustrator... This is where the EMCCV comes in! 

The EMCCV (Extendable Modular Creative Concept Visualizer) will give you the opportunity to create professional concept art of your characters by choosing among a multitude of options to create a look that represents your character well! Everything down to the expression, hair style, pose, clothing, weapons and more are customizable with multiple styles even, and you can colourize every single aspect with an unlimited palette of colours. The additional randomization features will allow you to inspire yourself with surprising combinations that you may never have thought of! 


History & Future

I've created a tool like this before, specifically for Sailor Moon fans: SailorXv3:

I've been developing this concept since 2002 and LOVE continuously improving it. 
After three previous Sailor Moon specific applications I want to make it interesting to fans of other genres, too! I am therefore returning to the roots by going the viewer/doll route as known from the Kisekae Set System (aka KiSS). (The EMCCV will be the viewer, SailorXv4 would be one of many more dolls to follow!) 
As with KiSS you will also be able to submit your own dolls to the future EMCCV website! There will even be a wizard to help you do it! 
I have hired a professional concept artist Miranda Rose Crowell for the artwork and a team of enthusiasts to help me out with programming, quality control and publicity.

We've been working on the first base body this past month and these are the poses we have come up with! All arm/hand styles - except hand in hip - are available for both sides:



What We Need & What You Get

Your contribution will be used to pay for the artwork. As a thank you to the loyal fanbase of SailorXv3 and predecessors, the first doll will be of an adult female humanoid with all the gear necessary to create a sailor soldier.

The first $2100 will go towards the basic female character with lots of expressions (eyes, brows and lips can be manipulated separately), poses, including a graceful walk, firm stance, hands to hold a wand, staff, knives, swords, hurl a magical attack, float crystals and fireballs and the likes - and an insane amount of mix & match hair options! As well as a basic leotard.

The next $650 will go towards the SailorXv4 extension: All clothes and items necessary to create a Sailor Soldier.

What comes next will be up to you! This could be new dolls (male, different body types and ages) or extensions (additional items/clothes) for the female adult character, Examples: Medieval Fantasy set, Steam Punk, Star Wars, Ster Trek, Super Hero,... let me know what would tickle you! 

If the goal isn't reached I will simply order as much artwork as the budget permits and order everything else later when funds permit.

I have already paid for the first base body to have something to show to you:


The Impact

I want to reactivate the old Kisekae community! Get everyone together again on the future EMCCV website to exchange ideas, store and share your creations, start collaborations for new dolls and keep adding new features to the EMCCV! The website will also have a forum and an online roleplaying gaming platform!

While many would recognize the EMCCV as a dress-up game, I prefer to call the EMCCV a Concept Design Tool to address professional creators, too. Future modules will also include items and landscapes, so the term "doll" would be misleading.

There are many anime/manga themed doll makers, but as a Marvel comic fan my personal passion lies with more realistic proportions. I think Miranda is perfect for the job! But I hope that some of the old KiSS artists will join in and create their own anime/manga themed dolls or reactivate their old ones!


Risks & Challenges

With SailorXv3 I already developed a viable solution for the EMCCV. The challenge now is to make the EMCCV playable in the browser as well as offering it as a downloadable. First experiments are already running and it's looking GREAT!! We are adding features I never even thought of because... it turned out to be quite easy!

 The only uncertainty therefore is the timing. I can't tell you when the EMCCV will officially launch for beta testing. Depending on how fast I can raise the funds for the artwork and depending on how busy life gets it could take a year or more. But I am optimistic that I will be able to release the first beta in 2016 if not sooner! 


Other Ways You Can Help

Are you a java web developer? Familiar with JavaFX 8 and or multi-user websites? If you have any relevant experience you are welcome to join the team! 

I am also running an ongoing Patreon campaign, if smaller monthly amounts suit you better. As a patron you also get access to larger previews as well as WIPs in addition to a variety of perks. You'll find the campaign here: http://www.patreon.com/EMCCV

In any case please help me spread the word! If you know any creative people or doll-maker lovers send them this way! Let's start building that community! :)
story_txt:
UPDATE:

Thank you everybody! You can find the newest previews on  the EMCCV website and more so on my SailorXv3 deviantart account! A prototype has been sent to all contributors on January 7th and 8th! Development is ongoing and very exciting! :)Short Summary Ever had an idea for a character? You love dress-up games or you're some kind of story-teller, writer, gamer, fan. Now you want to share your idea with your friends, publisher, illustrator... This is where the EMCCV comes in! 
The EMCCV (Extendable Modular Creative Concept Visualizer) will give you the opportunity to create professional concept art of your characters by choosing among a multitude of options to create a look that represents your character well! Everything down to the expression, hair style, pose, clothing, weapons and more are customizable with multiple styles even, and you can colourize every single aspect with an unlimited palette of colours. The additional randomization features will allow you to inspire yourself with surprising combinations that you may never have thought of! 

History & Future
I've created a tool like this before, specifically for Sailor Moon fans: SailorXv3:

I've been developing this concept since 2002 and LOVE continuously improving it. After three previous Sailor Moon specific applications I want to make it interesting to fans of other genres, too! I am therefore returning to the roots by going the viewer/doll route as known from the Kisekae Set System (aka KiSS). (The EMCCV will be the viewer, SailorXv4 would be one of many more dolls to follow!) As with KiSS you will also be able to submit your own dolls to the future EMCCV website! There will even be a wizard to help you do it! I have hired a professional concept artist Miranda Rose Crowell for the artwork and a team of enthusiasts to help me out with programming, quality control and publicity.

We've been working on the first base body this past month and these are the poses we have come up with! All arm/hand styles - except hand in hip - are available for both sides:






What We Need & What You Get Your contribution will be used to pay for the artwork. As a thank you to the loyal fanbase of SailorXv3 and predecessors, the first doll will be of an adult female humanoid with all the gear necessary to create a sailor soldier.
The first $2100 will go towards the basic female character with lots of expressions (eyes, brows and lips can be manipulated separately), poses, including a graceful walk, firm stance, hands to hold a wand, staff, knives, swords, hurl a magical attack, float crystals and fireballs and the likes - and an insane amount of mix & match hair options! As well as a basic leotard.
The next $650 will go towards the SailorXv4 extension: All clothes and items necessary to create a Sailor Soldier.
What comes next will be up to you! This could be new dolls (male, different body types and ages) or extensions (additional items/clothes) for the female adult character, Examples: Medieval Fantasy set, Steam Punk, Star Wars, Ster Trek, Super Hero,... let me know what would tickle you! 
If the goal isn't reached I will simply order as much artwork as the budget permits and order everything else later when funds permit.
I have already paid for the first base body to have something to show to you:


The Impact
I want to reactivate the old Kisekae community! Get everyone together again on the future EMCCV website to exchange ideas, store and share your creations, start collaborations for new dolls and keep adding new features to the EMCCV! The website will also have a forum and an online roleplaying gaming platform!

While many would recognize the EMCCV as a dress-up game, I prefer to call the EMCCV a Concept Design Tool to address professional creators, too. Future modules will also include items and landscapes, so the term "doll" would be misleading.
There are many anime/manga themed doll makers, but as a Marvel comic fan my personal passion lies with more realistic proportions. I think Miranda is perfect for the job! But I hope that some of the old KiSS artists will join in and create their own anime/manga themed dolls or reactivate their old ones!


Risks & Challenges
 With SailorXv3 I already developed a viable solution for the EMCCV. The challenge now is to make the EMCCV playable in the browser as well as offering it as a downloadable. First experiments are already running and it's looking GREAT!! We are adding features I never even thought of because... it turned out to be quite easy!
 The only uncertainty therefore is the timing. I can't tell you when the EMCCV will officially launch for beta testing. Depending on how fast I can raise the funds for the artwork and depending on how busy life gets it could take a year or more. But I am optimistic that I will be able to release the first beta in 2016 if not sooner! 
   Other Ways You Can Help Are you a java web developer? Familiar with JavaFX 8 and or multi-user websites? If you have any relevant experience you are welcome to join the team! 
I am also running an ongoing Patreon campaign, if smaller monthly amounts suit you better. As a patron you also get access to larger previews as well as WIPs in addition to a variety of perks. You'll find the campaign here: http://www.patreon.com/EMCCV
In any case please help me spread the word! If you know any creative people or doll-maker lovers send them this way! Let's start building that community! :)

story:
Young Afrocentric Dynamic Artist

Looking at a young entrepreneur and artist from the Limpopo province in South Africa, you may wonder if PitsiRa Ragophala has found a few more hours in a day. PitsiRa is a BUSY man.  He is creating waves of change and progress in his home of Johannesburg where he has resided for 7 years. An inspiration to everyone who comes in contact with him, this young, dynamic, afrocentric artist proves that nothing is impossible.

As an entrepreneur he recently started his own travel company, True Routes Travel and has hosted tours in September 2015 for people traveling to from Brooklyn, New York to South Africa. The next group from Brooklyn is coming in October 2015. True Routes Travel gives people an opportunity to choose a route exploring culture that best fits their needs.

PitsiRa teaches yoga, to the community in Yeoville, as well as judges in Johannesburg High Court and currently a Kemetic Yoga Trainee. He runs a coffee business called Kahawa Club. He hosts monthly showcases featuring upcoming South African performers, called Spooky Sundays. He hosts community empowerment programs with Eboukosini Solutions, called Shabaka Men of Afrika and Afrikan Lunch.  As PitsiRa develops his career, he continues to nurture young people coming up behind him through a monthly African- centered entrepreneurship program called Street Academy.

“My life is so fascinating, thanks to God and angels. True Routes Travel is a company that lops and exposes stories about our heritage and offer people of the world more new knowledge and information about our country  I am so inspired by all musicians. In my style I merge world rhythms mixing African and Western melodies.  I have been a yoga practitioner for 7 years and have taught throughout Johannesburg for 4 years. My style is influenced by African, Indian and Western styles  I call it Rama yoga which focuses on balancing masculine and feminine energy(yin and yang). .  

While some people may wonder how he is accomplishing so much, in such a short time, PitsiRa keeps propelling forward. This young dynamic afro-centric artist plans to visit New York to expand and develop his business, True Routes Travels, with Brooklyn –based organization Bridges: A Pan- Afrikan Arts Movement.


Your contributions will go far. Be a part of the YADA movement.

  • The round trip ticket from South Africa to New York  costs R15 00 or $1500

  • Accommodations are R4 000 or $400

  • Food costs for 3 weeks are R3 000 or $300

  • Transportation costs R1 500 or $150

  • Admission to cultural events, museums, arts centers, theaters, etc. R1 200 or $120

  • Prepaid phone will cost R500 or $50

  • Additional expenses R3 500 or $350

Your contibution to YADA will get you to choose from  these Specials...

        $10 or R100

       True Routes Travel Stickers

  • $20 or R200

    True Routes Travel Magnet

    $50 or R500

    Free Poem/song and a yoga session in Polokwane, Tshwane, Johannesburg New York-Brooklyn or recommend for your friend or Family memeber.

    $100 or R1 000

  • A thank you in a form a picture of you drawn up for you, a of 6-7 hour tour to Soweto, Sophiatown, Jhb City and Maboneng Precinct

  • $200 or R 2000

    Choose your gift from the list above

    $500 or R5 000

    Choose your gift from the list above and a dinner for two prepared by PitsiRa in New York York or South Africa

    $1000 or R10 000

    Choose your own gift and 25% discount on trip booked completely through True Routes Travel.

    $2000 or  R20 000

    Choose your own gift and 50% discount on trip booked completely through True Routes Travel.


    •  If the funding goal for YADA is not reached I will have to cut back on some of the activities I have planned. I will travel to New York but I will be limited in my ability to develop the connections I strive to achieve.

The Impact

“Motho ke motho ka batho” is an Ubuntu principle which means I am because you are which applies to the work of YADA and the communities which will be supported in both New York and South Africa. Each one teach one! The work I do brings joy to people. My music is therapy, yoga is healing and the empowerment work strengthens the community.  Supporting this project will make a difference in the lives of the people from Johannesburg to New York.

story:
I'm Noel Regachuelo, a freelance comics artist, graphic designer, painter, community organizer and also actively maintaining www.greenhouseinfoshop.blogspot.com. I studied Digital Illustration and Animation, unfortunately i stopped schooling due to financial crisis.  I already released my own self published comics and exhibited mixed media art works in galleries. 

There are millions of memes in the internet but there are few significant memes that are worth collecting. My book project "Memoir of memes" is a collection of dissident memes in the internet. Civil unrest, demonstration, revolution, graffiti, revolts are some topics of the book, i think it is important to have an archive of memes thru a book. Since "meme" is an idea, behaviour, style or usage that spreads from person to person within a culture, meme is the mirror of our generation, it reflects the situation of our culture, politics, art and everyday life.

I hope you can help me promote my book project to other people and raise the publishing expenses. The goal fund of the project is $1000 or 46,535 in Philippine Peso. The amount will be used for production costs for publishing, printing and promotion. I will also send some PDF format of the book for anyone who will donate, if had an opportunity i can also send you a physical copy of the book. If i didn't meet the goal of fund, ill try to self publish it like a fanzine.

Since is its a collection of memes, is also for entertainment and educational purposes. its also an assemblage of ideas, philosophies, aphorism, photos, drawings, graphics, illustrations, statements, etc.. I think it is an important book project because it will give us new information, perspective and ideas. The book is also COPYLEFT.

Ill be giving a free copy of the book to those who helped me and supported my endeavors. Thank you.

In Solidarity!

-Noel Regachuelo

story:
Who am I and What is this all about

Hello, I'm Shiela Alejandro, I'm a digital artist. 




I have a passion for doing personal portraits! For two years I have earned my living as a freelance artist. Being a freelance artist has been fun and exciting. I’ve worked with people from all over the world on projects that have challenged me and helped me grow as an artist. Now I am ready to pursue my passion for personal portraits. 

About the Project

I want to pursue my passion. I want to take the time to do the studies of people, in the park and other places. I want to focus my attention on developing my craft as a portrait artist. For now, because of my busy work schedule for clients, I’ve been limited to doing digital portraits for my friend and family and sometimes for my cat. Which means that the opportunity to really grow in this area has been limited which is why I’m asking for your support. By funding my project you can help me buy the time to focus on just doing portraits and bringing people, and their pets, the joy of a personal portrait! And it’s YOU, you’re friends, family and loved ones who will be the first to benefit from my work! To get an idea of my commercial work here are some of my illustrations for my commercial clients: 




It's about YOU

Like I said, YOU will be the FIRST to benefit from my work. I’ve seen a lot of campaigns raise money for artists. Many of the artists are famous or nearly famous. I’ve watched them SKYROCKET in the first week and exceed ALL their funding goals. Honestly, I’ m really nervous. You see, the thing is I’m not famous,yet. I don’t have a huge fan base or a facebook following. In fact, I’m pretty shy when it comes to talking to people. So I thought, “How can I succeed?” Then I realized I could succeed the same way I’ve succeed as a freelance artist, by working hard and doing something special for you! Every perk I’m offering for you is less than what I would charge a commercial client. Why? Because the perks I’m offering are personal portraits. Imagine YOU having a personal portrait of yourself, a loved one or friend and being able to say, “This is by an artist I’m sponsoring.” Whether you want to give it as a gift, have it displayed at home or in your place of work you will be able to share with the world the fact that YOU ARE A PATRON OF THE ARTS!
I’m not asking you to give me something for nothing. I’m asking you, my patron, to let me draw YOU, do your portrait, let me celebrate the fact that YOU ARE MY PATRON.

 It's yours, whatever subject you want! your choice!

Your Impact!

You might be saying, “Yes, Shiela, I want to support you. I can see you are a talented and hardworking artist. But can you REALLY do my portrait?”
As you can see from my work, I do a range of styles and techniques for my clients. Most of what I do professionally is published in books, magazines or used on expensive websites. But most of them aren’t portraits. Here is the thing, and as I’ve said I’m very shy, so talking about this is a really hard for me. When I’m not working, I’m studying, practicing and taking classes; even online classes! This is my passion! It is SO much my passion, that I’m going WAY outside my comfort zone to ask YOU to be my patron. So here is my promise to you. In exchange for your support, at one of my perk levels, I will produce, just for YOU, a very special and very personal digital portrait. It can be you or your friend, your parent, your significant other or your pet (yes, more fur please!) 

Let's go!!

I am very excited and very passionate about this. I hope you are too. If you have questions or inquiries you can email me at alejandrosheng.sa@gmail.com 

THANK YOU SO MUCH! *virtual hug*

story:
Wooden Unique Designed Ambient Lamps for interiors and exteriors! The best gift you can give to the loved ones (or yourself).


Hi Indiegogos! 

My name is Dominik, I am from Croatia and I am the founder of GEA Workshops - Unique Ambient Lamps.


                            

I came to the idea of creating wooden unique ambient lamps by being disappointed into the choice I didnt have in the local "Lamp stores". I was so disappointed and frustrated that I putted things into my own hands. First lamp that I have created led to another, after that to one more and so on... I was hooked-up. This is the job I waited whole my life, this is something I love, I dream about every single day, this is something that motivates me to go even further and beyond my limits. This is something that makes me happy from the moment I open my eyes till the end of the day when I close them.  

The First GEA Lamp


                             

My guidance is that every single lamp has to be unique on it own way, there could be similar lamps, but never the same. It is the same when you want from an artist to paint the same picture one more time, he will use the same brushes, the same colors, the same paper, the same brush-moves, but the end result will never be the same again. This is art, and i strongly believe it should stay that way.


                              

My ideas for lamps comes from everywhere, I see something in the newspapers, on the street, in public transportation, in my home, on the family vacation... it really doesn't matter, the idea comes when I least expect it. To be clear, I'm not trying to copy anything, for every design I create, I do my best to bring something new and original to life.


                             

I work with all kinds of materials, from wood, metal, paper, plastic to glass, fabric and so on. But the most positive reactions I got from the wooden square shaped lamps, and that is something I want to share with you guys here on INDIEGOGO.

There are 3 sizes of square shaped GEA Unique Ambient Lamps that I want to introduce you with:

  • STANDARD (250×250×1200 mm / 9.8×9.8×47.2 inch)
  • MIDI (250×250×1000 mm / 9.8×9.8×39,3 inch)
  • MINI (250×250×800 mm / 9.8×9.8×31.4 inch)

Names, sizes and dimensions


                             

We currently have a nice variety of colors prepared for the fabric we use to cover the lamps with. From the basic colors to some complex ones. Of course we strive to expand the color palette in the future also as quality that we think it should went on a higher level. Don't get me wrong, the quality of current fabrics we use is on really high level at the moment, but we always think we can do better.


Currently available colors



                             

There are six (6) editions of wooden square shaped GEA Unique Ambient Lamps:

GEA MINI EDITION 

Example of GEA Mini Edition - Dimensions: (250×250×800 mm / 9.8×9.8×31.4 inch) with black wooden structure, one color fabric, E14 bulb holder, 2m black wire installation with switch


GEA MIDI EDITION 

Example of GEA Midi Edition - Dimensions: (250×250×1000 mm / 9.8×9.8×39,3 inch) with black wooden structure, one color fabric, E14 bulb holder, 2m black wire installation with switch


GEA STANDARD EDITION 

Example of GEA Standard Edition - Dimensions: (250×250×1200 mm / 9.8×9.8×47.2 inch) with black wooden structure, one color fabric, E14 bulb holder, 2m black wire installation with switch


GEA LIMITED EDITION 

Example of GEA Limited Edition - Dimensions: (250×250×1200 mm / 9.8×9.8×47.2 inch) with black or white wooden structure, one to two colored fabric with limited edition decals, E14 bulb holder, 2m black or white wire installation with switch


GEA DESIGNER EDITION 

Example of GEA Designer Edition - Dimensions: (250×250×1200 mm / 9.8×9.8×47.2 inch) with black or white wooden structure, two to three colored fabric with special decals and decor, E14 bulb holder, 2m black or white wire installation with switch


GEA INDIEGOGO EDITION​

Example of GEA Indiegogo Edition - Dimensions: (250×250×1200 mm / 9.8×9.8×47.2 inch) with special colored wooden structure, two to three colored fabric with special decals, decor and art, E14 bulb holder, 2 to 10m black or white wire installation with switch


  • Warning: The images are solely for information purposes and does not represent the fully polished lamp like the one you will get.
  • Warning(2): Lightning bulbs are not included with GEA Unique Ambient Lamps.

                            

Till the few days ago, I have worked and operated all alone on this project from the morning to evening. My wonderful wife and my uncle help me when they have some spare time and that means a lot. It will be much easier if they could work with me full time but I'm not complaining, this is how it should be at the moment.

Preparation for working day...

Creation of one unique ambient lamp takes from 24 to 72 hours, depends on its complexity, level of details and so on. Of course , due to the drying process , it is possible to simultaneously work on several lamps at the same time. I can design and create 5 to 6 lamps per day without any problems. 

Working hours in GEA Workshops...

Delivery process should not be an issue at all. I'm an workaholic by the nature so even 7 to 8 lamps per day doesn't make a difference (without affecting the quality and the end result).


                           

We currently have three active members of the GEA workshops that assist in the production:


Unfortunately, only I work full time at the moment because there is not enough funding to hire all at the same time. If the campaign is successful, this will definitely change.

Little about us:

  • Dominik - Artistic Soul, Brainstormer, Man of Action
  • Nyssa - Logistic, Support, Idea Master
  • Danijel (& his dog Abba) - Mentor, Visionary, Out of the Box Thinker
We are a small, but highly efficient team of creators and designers. We believe that there is no obstacle we can not overcome, its only a matter of time.


                           

The main goal of this project is to provide an opportunity for a working man to do what he truly loves, what he is truly looking forward to do every single day of his life with a smile on his face. It would be a dream come true, not just for me, but also for my family that supports me unconditionally.

My plan is to make beautiful things, to expand the product range with some new furniture ideas that people can buy and admire. 

After some time I want to help and hire a few more people who share the same dream , the same goal, the same vision , the same joy in life by creating something new, something unique and something different.


                           


                              

I know what a diverse choice global market offers on the ambient lamps point of view because of its serial production benefits, the variety and possibilities are endless, but thats something I dont want to offer (not in serial production way at least). Serial production is something I never want to do. Lamps will lose on quality, uniqueness and at the end, they will lose "that magic" touch that only a designer can give, that breath of life You have to put into it to be what is supposed to be, I would say it is a soul of a lamp. 


                           

First of all, big thanks to everyone who recognized this project as something that worth big time. We will not disappoint you guys! Thank You from the bottom of our hearts! 


LET'S MAKE THIS HAPPEN!



                          

1. Q: When will I receive my order?

     A:The first and second product shipment are expected in March and May 2016, 

 (We handcraft each and every GEA Unique Ambient Lamps and make sure all of them are polished and perfected)

2. Q: What should I do if I’ve bought one GEA Lamp and want to buy one more?

     A: Please simply contribute to one more perk. :)

3. Q: Do I get a discount on the price/shipping fee if I buy more than one GEA Lamp?

     A: On the prices: The current prices of GEA Lamps are already discounted ones! But be quick, there are only limited amount of discounted ones.

On the shipping fee: Two GEA Lamp doubles the volumetric weight, so the shipping companies would charge twice. (I.e. no discount will be provided by them)

4. Q: In which colors can I get GEA Lamp?

     A: You can choose from warm to cold colors presented on GEA - Current Color Palette picture.

5. Q: What type of plug and voltage is it for GEA Lamps?

     A: It's two plugged and 220V. Since the plug and voltage condition vary in         different countries, please prepare your own plug adapter and converter if needed.

6. Q: How long is the electric cord of GEA Lamp?

     A: It's roughly 2 meters. From the visible part of the lamp, till the electric socket.

7. Q: Why is the shipping fee so expensive?

     A: GEA Lamp is basically pretty strong and even though we made excellent protection packaging, it is still considered fragile by courier companies. So it'll be charged a higher shipping fee.

8. Q: Can we change the light bulb inside GEA Lamp?

     A: Yes. You can change the light bulb without any problems.

9. Q: Can I wash GEA Lamp?

     A: Yes, you can wash GEA Lamp by brushing it slightly with water. But we do not recommend it.

10. Q: Will GEA Lamp be damaged in the shipment process?

     A: We’ve used careful packaging as a way of protection, so you don’t have to worry about it.


Disclaimer required in Paypal policies: "Delivery of rewards/perks is subject to best efforts and not guaranteed."
story_txt:
Wooden Unique Designed Ambient Lamps for interiors and exteriors! The best gift you can give to the loved ones (or yourself).Hi Indiegogos! My name is Dominik, I am from Croatia and I am the founder of GEA Workshops - Unique Ambient Lamps.                            I came to the idea of creating wooden unique ambient lamps by being disappointed into the choice I didnt have in the local "Lamp stores". I was so disappointed and frustrated that I putted things into my own hands. First lamp that I have created led to another, after that to one more and so on... I was hooked-up. This is the job I waited whole my life, this is something I love, I dream about every single day, this is something that motivates me to go even further and beyond my limits. This is something that makes me happy from the moment I open my eyes till the end of the day when I close them.



 The First GEA Lamp                             My guidance is that every single lamp has to be unique on it own way, there could be similar lamps, but never the same. It is the same when you want from an artist to paint the same picture one more time, he will use the same brushes, the same colors, the same paper, the same brush-moves, but the end result will never be the same again. This is art, and i strongly believe it should stay that way.                              My ideas for lamps comes from everywhere, I see something in the newspapers, on the street, in public transportation, in my home, on the family vacation... it really doesn't matter, the idea comes when I least expect it. To be clear, I'm not trying to copy anything, for every design I create, I do my best to bring something new and original to life.                             I work with all kinds of materials, from wood, metal, paper, plastic to glass, fabric and so on. But the most positive reactions I got from the wooden square shaped lamps, and that is something I want to share with you guys here on INDIEGOGO.There are 3 sizes of square shaped GEA Unique Ambient Lamps that I want to introduce you with:
STANDARD (250×250×1200 mm / 9.8×9.8×47.2 inch)
MIDI (250×250×1000 mm / 9.8×9.8×39,3 inch)
MINI (250×250×800 mm / 9.8×9.8×31.4 inch)
Names, sizes and dimensions                             We currently have a nice variety of colors prepared for the fabric we use to cover the lamps with. From the basic colors to some complex ones. Of course we strive to expand the color palette in the future also as quality that we think it should went on a higher level. Don't get me wrong, the quality of current fabrics we use is on really high level at the moment, but we always think we can do better.Currently available colors                             There are six (6) editions of wooden square shaped GEA Unique Ambient Lamps:GEA MINI EDITION Example of GEA Mini Edition - Dimensions: (250×250×800 mm / 9.8×9.8×31.4 inch) with black wooden structure, one color fabric, E14 bulb holder, 2m black wire installation with switchGEA MIDI EDITION Example of GEA Midi Edition - Dimensions: (250×250×1000 mm / 9.8×9.8×39,3 inch) with black wooden structure, one color fabric, E14 bulb holder, 2m black wire installation with switchGEA STANDARD EDITION Example of GEA Standard Edition - Dimensions: (250×250×1200 mm / 9.8×9.8×47.2 inch) with black wooden structure, one color fabric, E14 bulb holder, 2m black wire installation with switchGEA LIMITED EDITION Example of GEA Limited Edition - Dimensions: (250×250×1200 mm / 9.8×9.8×47.2 inch) with black or white wooden structure, one to two colored fabric with limited edition decals, E14 bulb holder, 2m black or white wire installation with switchGEA DESIGNER EDITION Example of GEA Designer Edition - Dimensions: (250×250×1200 mm / 9.8×9.8×47.2 inch) with black or white wooden structure, two to three colored fabric with special decals and decor, E14 bulb holder, 2m black or white wire installation with switchGEA INDIEGOGO EDITION​Example of GEA Indiegogo Edition - Dimensions: (250×250×1200 mm / 9.8×9.8×47.2 inch) with special colored wooden structure, two to three colored fabric with special decals, decor and art, E14 bulb holder, 2 to 10m black or white wire installation with switchWarning: The images are solely for information purposes and does not represent the fully polished lamp like the one you will get.Warning(2): Lightning bulbs are not included with GEA Unique Ambient Lamps.                            Till the few days ago, I have worked and operated all alone on this project from the morning to evening. My wonderful wife and my uncle help me when they have some spare time and that means a lot. It will be much easier if they could work with me full time but I'm not complaining, this is how it should be at the moment.Preparation for working day...Creation of one unique ambient lamp takes from 24 to 72 hours, depends on its complexity, level of details and so on. Of course , due to the drying process , it is possible to simultaneously work on several lamps at the same time. I can design and create 5 to 6 lamps per day without any problems. Working hours in GEA Workshops...Delivery process should not be an issue at all. I'm an workaholic by the nature so even 7 to 8 lamps per day doesn't make a difference (without affecting the quality and the end result).                            We currently have three active members of the GEA workshops that assist in the production:Unfortunately, only I work full time at the moment because there is not enough funding to hire all at the same time. Dominik - Artistic Soul, Brainstormer, Man of Action
Nyssa - Logistic, Support, Idea Master
Danijel (& his dog Abba) - Mentor, Visionary, Out of the Box Thinker
